41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And a sign for them is that We bore their offspring in a laden Ark.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they ride.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if We please, We may drown them, then there will be none to reach to their cry nor they shall be rescued.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But a mercy from Us and a convenience for a time.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when it is said to them, 'fear what is before you and what is to come behind you that perchance you may receive mercy, then they turn their faces'.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whenever there comes to them any sign out of the signs of their Lord, they turn their faces from it.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when it is said to them, spend something out of that with which Allah has provided you', then the infidels say to the Muslims, 'shall we feed those whom Allah would have fed, if He had so willed? You are not but in a manifest error.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they say, 'when this promise will come, if you are truthful?

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They wait not but for a shriek that will seize them when they will be busy in worldly disputes.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then neither they will be able to make a will nor will they return to their homes.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the trumpet shall be blown, henceforth they will walk running towards their Lord from their graves.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will say, 'Ah', woe to us', who has awakened us from our sleeping. This is what the Most Affectionate had promised and the Messengers told the truth.

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It will not be but a horrible shrieking, henceforth they all shall be presented before Us.

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So today no soul shall be wronged, and you shall not be recompensed but what you have done.

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, the inmates of Heaven are enjoying their, entertainment comfortably.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They and their wives are in shades reclining on raised couches.

57.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): There is a fruit therein for them and there is for them whatever they ask for.

58.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Peace will be on them, a word from the Merciful Lord.

59.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And to day, be separate, O you culprits!

60.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O children of Adam, Had I not made covenant with you that you should not worship the devil (Satan), verily he is your manifest enemy.

61.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that you should worship Me. This is the straight path.

62.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, he has led astray a great number of people from you. Had you then no wisdom?

63.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is the Hell, which you were promised.

64.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Enter it today, the recompense of your infidelity.

65.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Today, We shall set seal on their mouths and their hands will talk to us and their feet will bear witness of their doings.

66.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If We willed, We would have obliterated their eyes, then they would have rushed towards the path but they would see nothing.

67.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If We willed, We would have mutilated their faces sitting in their homes, they could not be able to go on or could return.

68.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And to whosoever We give long life, We revert him in creation. Do they then not understand?

69.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We have not taught him to compose verses and nor it is befitting to his dignity. It is not but admonition and luminous Quran.

70.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In order that it may warn him who is alive and the word may be proved against the infidels.

71.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And have they not seen that We have created from them Our hand made cattle, so they are their owners?

72.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We have subjected the same for them that some of them they ride and some others they eat.

73.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And there are in them various other benefits and drinks for them. Will they not be thankful?

74.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they have taken besides Allah other gods that perhaps they may be helped.

75.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They can not help them, but they and their army all shall be brought before arrested.

76.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore let not their speech grieve you, Undoubtedly, We know what they conceal and what they disclose.

77.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And has the man not seen that We have made him from a sperm, henceforth he is an open disputant?

78.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And he says for Us a similitude and has forgotten his creation. He said, 'who will give life to the bones when they are totally rotten.'

79.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, He will give life to them, Who made them the first time. And He Knows every creation.

80.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who produced fire for you out of the green tree, henceforth you kindle therefrom.

81.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And what! He who created the heavens and the earth can not make the like of them. Why not, and He is the Great Creator, all Knowing.

82.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For Him is this only that whenever He intends any thing, then He says to it, 'Be' and it becomes at once.

83.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, Sanctified is He in Whose hand is the control of every thing, and towards Him, you will be returned.

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By those Who range them selves in ranks properly.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then by those who drive by chiding.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then by those groups that recites Quran.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, your God is necessarily One.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is in between them and the Lord of the casts.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We adorned the lower heaven with the adornment of the stars.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And a safeguard from every contumacious devil (Satan).

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They can not give ear towards heavenly world and they are pelted from every side.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): To drive them away and for them is the perpetual torment.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But he who carries away by swooping once or twice then are at once followed by a bright burning flame.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore ask them, is their creation stronger or Our other creations heavens and angels etc? Undoubtedly We have made them of sticking clay.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But you do wonder and they ridicule it.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when they are made to understand, they understand not.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when they see any sign, they ridicule it.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they say, 'this is not but an open magic'.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What! when we become dust and bones after death, shall we necessarily be raised?

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And our former fore-fathers too?

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'yes, and you shall be disgraced ones'.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then it will be only a single horrible shout, henceforth they will begin to see.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they will say, 'woe, alas to us it will be said to them' 'This is the Day of Requital.'

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is the Day of judgement, which you used to belie.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Drive and bring together the oppressors and their companions, and what they used to worship.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Beside Allah, and drive them to the path of the Fire.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And stop them, they are to be questioned.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What happened to you, why you do not help each other?

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nay, today they have surrendered themselves.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And of them, one faced the other mutually questioning.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'you used to approach us for misleading from right side.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will reply, 'you yourselves were not believing.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We had no control over you, but rather you were a people contumacious.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, the sentence of our Lord has been proved against us that we are necessarily to taste.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And we misled you for we ourselves had gone astray.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore that day they are all sharers in the torment.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Thus, We do with the culprits.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, when it was said to them, 'None is to be worshipped beside Allah', they then swelled with pride.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they used to say, shall we indeed leave our gods, because of the saying of a mad poet?

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): No indeed, rather he has brought the truth and he has confirmed the Messengers.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, you are to taste a painful agony.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you shall not be recompensed but of your own doings.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But those who are the chosen bond men of Allah.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For them is that provision which is in Our knowledge.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Fruits, and they shall be honored.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In the Gardens of comfort.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will be on thrones face to face.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): There will be a round of a flowing drink cup before their eyes.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): White coloured, delicious to those who drink.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Wherein neither there is intoxication and nor their heads will become giddy wherewith.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they have those, who will not look towards any one else other than their husbands, having large eyes.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): As they are eggs preserved.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then of them one faced the other questioning.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A speaker from among them said, 'I had a mate of mine.'

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'Who used to say, do you take it to be true'?

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What! when we are rotten and will become dust and bones, shall we then be requited?

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He will say, 'will you peep and see?'

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he peeped and saw him in the midst of Flaming fire.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He said, By God, it was near that, you would cause me to perish.'

57.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And had it not been for the favour of my Lord, I would surely have been seized and presented'.

58.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Is it not then we are to die?

59.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But our first death and that we are not to be punished.

60.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): No doubt, this is the supreme triumph.

61.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, let the workers work the like of this.

62.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Is this entertainment better or the tree of Zaqqum? (Bearing bitter, un-tasty and sour fruits).

63.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have made it a test for the unjust.

64.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Verily, it is a tree, which grows in the bottom of Hell.

65.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Its spikes are like the heads of monsters.

66.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And verily they shall eat of it, And fill their bellies with it.

67.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then undoubtedly, for them there is in addition to it a mixture of boiling water.

68.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then their return is necessary towards a Flaming Fire.

69.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, they found their fathers erring.

70.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So they are rushing in their footsteps.

71.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, most of the ancient went astray before them.

72.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We sent warners in them.

73.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then look as to how was the end of those who were warned.

74.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Save the chosen devotees of Allah.

75.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, Nuh called to Us, and what excellent respondent are, We.

76.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We delivered him and his family from the great distress.

77.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We made his offspring the only survivors.

78.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We left for him a good name among later generations.

79.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Peace be upon Nuh among the people of the world.

80.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, thus We recompense the righteous.

81.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, he is among Our most dignified fully believing devotees.

82.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then We drowned the others.

83.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, Ibrahim belongs to his same group.

84.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When he came to his Lord with a pure heart.

85.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When he said to his father and his people, 'what do you worship'?

86.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you desire false gods beside Allah?

87.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What do you think about the Lord of the worlds?

88.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he cast a glance at the stars.

89.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he said, 'I am about to be sick'.

90.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then they turned back from him.

91.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he walked towards their gods secretly and said, 'do you not eat'?

92.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What happened to you that you speak not?

93.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then avoiding sight of the people, he began to strike them with his right hand.

94.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then the infidels rushed to wards him.

95.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He said, 'do you worship What your hand carved out.'

96.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah has created you and what you make.

97.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'build for him a building, then cast him in the flaming fire.

98.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then they intended to design a plan against him, but We brought them low.

99.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And he said, 'I am to go to my Lord' now He shall guide me.

100.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'My Lord, bestow me a righteous son.'

101.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then We gave him a glad tiding of a prudent son.

102.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when he became able to work with him, he said, 'O my son, I have dreamt that I am slaughtering you, now look you, what is your opinion'. He said, 'O my father, do as you are commanded, Allah willing, you will find me patient.'

103.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when they both submitted to My command and the father laid down his son on forehead.

104.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We called to him, O Ibrahim,

105.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, you have fulfilled the vision; thus, We recompense the righteous.

106.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): No doubt, it was a bright test.

107.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice.

108.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We left a good name for him in later generations.

110.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And thus We recompense the righteous.

111.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, He is among Our most dignified fully believing devotees.

112.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We gave him the glad tidings of Ishaque, a Prophet the Communicator of unseen, one of the deserving men of our proximity.

113.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We blessed him and Ishaque. And among their progeny some are good doers, and are some who clearly wrong themselves.

114.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We bestowed favours on Musa and Haroon.

115.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We delivered them and their people from the great distress.

116.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We helped them, so they became dominant.

117.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We bestowed to both a luminous Book.

118.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We showed them straight path.

119.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And left their good names in later generations.

120.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Peace be upon Musa and Maroon.

121.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, thus We recompense the righteous.

122.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, they are among Our most dignified Fully believing devotees.

123.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, Elyas is among Messengers.

124.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When he said to his people 'do you not fear'?

125.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you worship Baal and leave the Best Creator?

126.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah, Who is your Lord and the Lord of your forefather`?

127.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then-he belied him, so necessity, they will come accosted.

128.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But the chosen devotees of Allah.

129.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We left his good name in later generation.

131.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, thus We recompense the righteous.

132.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Verily, he is among Our most dignified fully believing devotees.

133.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And verily Lut is among Our Messengers.

134.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When We delivered him and his all family members.

135.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But an old woman who was among those who remained behind.

137.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, you pass by them in the morning

138.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And at night. Do you then have no wisdom?

139.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And verily, Yunus is among Messengers.

140.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When he went away towards a laden boat.

141.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And cast lots and was of the pushed ones.

142.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then the fish swallowed him and he was blaming himself.

143.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And had he not been of those who glorify Allah.

144.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He would have necessarily remained in its belly until the day when the people shall be raised.

145.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then We cast him on a bare place and he was sick.

146.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We caused to grow over him a tree of gourd.

147.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We sent him towards a hundred thousand rather more.

148.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they believed, then We allowed them to enjoy for a time.

149.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Now ask them 'are the daughters for your Lord and for them sons?'

150.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or did We create the angels females, while they were present?

151.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you hear? Undoubtedly they say of their own calumny.

152.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah has begotten', and undoubtedly, they are necessarily liars.

153.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Has He chosen daughters leaving sons?

154.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What is the matter with you? How you order?

156.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or have you any clear authority?

157.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then bring your Book, if you are truthful.

158.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they have set up a relationship between Him and the Jinn. And undoubtedly, Jinn know that they shall be necessarily presented.

159.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Sanctified is Allah from what they describe.

160.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But the chosen bondmen of Allah.

161.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then neither you nor what you worship.

162.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): You are not to mislead any one against Him.

163.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But to him who is to go into the Flaming Fire.

164.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the angels say, everyone of us has a known station'.

165.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, we wait for the command spreading our wings.

167.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, they used to say.

168.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'If we had any admonition from the ancients.'

169.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then we would necessarily have been the chosen bondmen of Allah'.

170.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But they denied it, and then soon they will know.

171.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, Our word has already passed to Our sent one bondmen.

172.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That undoubtedly they shall be helped.

173.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, Our army would be dominant.

174.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So, turn your face from them for a while.

175.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And watch them, soon they will see.

176.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do they then seek our torment to hasten on?

177.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when it will descend into their courtyard. What an evil morning will be of those who were warned.

178.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So, turn your face from them for a while.

179.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And wait that they will soon see.

180.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Sanctity is to your Lord, the Lord of Dignity from what they describe.

181.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And peace be upon the Messengers.

182.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By this renowned Quran.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Rather the infidels are in pride and schism.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): How many a generation We destroyed before them, then now they cried when there was no time for deliverance

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they were surprised that a warner from among themselves came to them, and the infidels said, 'this is a magician, a great liar'

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Has he made one God of many gods? Undoubtedly, this is a strange thing.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the chiefs of them departed saying, 'go away from him and be steadfast to your gods; undoubtedly, he has some object in this

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We have not heard about this even in the latest religion of Christianity. This is indeed wholly a new invention.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Has the Quran been sent upon him from amongst us all? Nay, rather they are in doubt concerning My Book. Nay, they have not yet tasted My chastisement

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Are they treasurers of the mercy of your Lord, the Dignified, and the Bestower?

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Is the kingdom of the heavens and earth and what is between them for them? If so let them ascend by hanging ropes.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is a disgraced host from amongst the confederates, which shall be made to flee to the same place.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Before them, the people of Nuh and Aad and pharaoh (Firawn) the contriver of stakes have already belied (the Messengers).

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Samud and the people of Lut and dwellers of the wood. These are those parties.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): There is none among them but belied the Messengers, so My torment became inevitable.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They wait not but of a single roaring cry which no one can turn away.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they said, 'O our Lord, hasten to us our shares before the Day of Reckoning.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Bear you patiently at what they say, and remember Our bondman Daud a man of blessings; undoubtedly, he is a great penitent.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have subjected mountains, that they with him glorify Allah at evening and sunrise

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the birds assembled; all were obedient to him.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We strengthened his kingdom and bestowed him wisdom and decisive speech.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Has the tidings of the claimants reached to you when they came into Daud's mosque jumping over the walls?

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When they entered upon Daud, he became confused on account of them. They said, 'fear not, we are two disputants, one has shown high handedness against the other, therefore decide between us with truth and be not unjust and guide us to the right path.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, this is my brother, he has ninety-nine ewes and I have one ewe, now he says entrust this one also to me and presses me in speech.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Daud said, 'undoubtedly, he is doing injustice in demanding your ewe to add to his ewes. And certainly, many of the partners show high handedness against each other, but those who believe and do good, and they are very few. Now Daud guessed that We had tested him, therefore, he begged forgiveness of his Lord and fell in prostration and turned (to Allah). [^] (SAJDA

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then We forgave him that. And verily he has necessarily nearness to Us and an excellent resort.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O Daud', Undoubtedly, We have made you a vicegerent in the earth, therefore order between mankind with truth, and follow not desire, otherwise it would cause you to go astray from the path of Allah. Verily, those who go astray from the path of Allah, there is for them a severe torment for that they have forgotten the Day of Reckoning.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We have not made the heavens and the earth and what is in between them in vain. This is the thought of the infidels. There fore woe is to the infidels because of the Fire.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Shall We make those who have believed and have done good deeds like those who spread mischief in the earth or make the pious ones like wicked disobedients?

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is a Book that We have sent down towards you Blessed, so that they may ponder on its signs and that the men of wisdom may be admonished.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We bestowed on Daud, Sulaiman. What a fine bondman! Verily, he was most repenting.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When, in the after-noon were presented to him, horses when at ease standing on three feet and touching the ground with the tow of fourth foot, and when they run, they are very swift.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he said, 'I have loved the love of these horses for the remembrance of my Lord'. Then he ordered to drive them until they were hidden from his sight behind the veil.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he ordered that bring them back to me. Then he began to pass his hand over their shanks and necks.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We tested Sulaiman and placed on his throne a lifeless body, then he turned repented.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He said, 'O my Lord' for give me, and bestow me a Kingdom which may not suit to anyone else after me. Undoubtedly, You are the Big Bestower.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then We subjected the wind to him that it ran by his commandment softly, wherever he desired.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And subjected to him the giants (Satan), every builder and diver.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And others bound in fetters.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is Our gift, now you do favour upon whom you like or withhold there is no reckoning upon you.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, he has necessarily nearness to Us and an excellent resort.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And remember Our bondman Ayub. He called his Lord that the devil (Satan) has touched me with affliction and oppression.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We said, 'strike your foot with the ground, here is the cool, stream for bathing and for drinking.'

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We bestowed him his family and others like them in addition to them as a mercy from Us and as admonition to the people of understanding.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We said, 'take in your hand a broom of dry grass and strike there with and break not your oath. Undoubtedly, We found him steadfast, What an excellent bondman was he? Verily he is of returning.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And remember Our bondmen Ibrahim, Ishaq, and Yaqoob the men of authority and knowledge.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Verily, We distinguished them with a distinct speech that is the remembrance of that abode (Hereafter)

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, they are in Our sight chosen and favorites.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And remember Ismail, Al-Yasa, and Zulkifl. They are all excellent ones.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is an admonition. And undoubtedly, the resort of pious ones is good.'

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Gardens of perpetual abode, the doors of which are open for them.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Reclining therein on cushions, therein they ask for plenty of fruits and drink.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they have such wives with them that they look not towards others save their husbands, Companions of equal age.

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning.

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, this is Our provision which will never be exhausted.

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is for them (believers). But undoubtedly, for the contumacious is the evil resort.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Hell, that they shall enter it what is an evil couch.

57.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is for them, therefore let them taste it, boiling water and pus.

58.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And other couples of torments of the same nature.

59.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will be told, 'this is a troop of yours rushing in along with you'. They will say, let them not get any open place'. They are indeed to enter the Fire, let them remain there too in a strained place.'

60.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The followers said, 'nay! Rather you should not get an open place'. You brought this distress to us'. Therefore what an evil destination it is

61.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'O our Lord, whoso brought this distress to us, increase him in torment two fold in the Fire.

62.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'what has happened to us that we see not the men whom we used to count among evil ones'.

63.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Did we treat them in ridicule or our eyes are turned away from them?

64.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, it is necessarily a truth, the disputing together of the people of the Fire.

65.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'I am only a warner, and there is no god but Allah, the One All Dominant'.

66.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is in between, the Dignified, the Great Forgiver'.

67.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'that is a supreme news'.

68.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): You are negligent of it.

69.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What knowledge I had about heavenly world, when they disputed.

70.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): I am only revealed that I am not but a manifest warner.

71.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When your Lord said to the angels, I shall make man from the clay.

72.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And so when I have fashioned him perfectly, and have breathed into him of My spirit, then fall you down prostrating for him.

73.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): There fore angles fell down prostrate, all of them together.

74.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But Iblis He waxed proud, he was among the infidels.

75.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah said, O lblis', 'what hindered you from falling prostrate before that which I made with My own hands? Have you been proud or you were indeed among haughty ones?

76.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He said, 'I am better than him, You have made me of fire and created him of clay'.

77.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah said, 'get you out from the heaven, for you are rejected'.

78.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, My curse is on you till the Day of Judgement.

79.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He said, 'O my Lord, if it is so then grant me respite till the day when they are raised'.

80.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah said, 'certainly, you are of those that are granted respite'.

81.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'Till the day of the known time'.

82.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He said, 'By Your Dignity I shall necessarily, beguile them all'.

83.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'But those among them who are Your chosen bondmen'.

84.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah said, 'then the truth is this, and I speak the truth.

85.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, I shall necessarily fill Hell with you of those who will follow you all together.

86.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'I ask of you no wage for this Quran nor I am of those who affect.

87.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That is not but an admonition to the entire world.

88.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you shall surely know its news after a time

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The sending down of the Book is from Allah the Dignified, the Wise.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have sent down this Book to you with truth, therefore worship Allah being purely His devotee.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Yes, the sincere exclusive devotion is to Allah only. And those who have taken for protectors other than Allah say, 'we worship them only so that they may bring us nearer to Allah'. Allah will decide among them concerning that wherein they are differing. Undoubtedly, Allah guides not him who is a great ungrateful liar.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If Allah had willed to take a son for Himself, He would have chosen whom He had pleased out of His creation, Sanctity is to Him. He is Allah the one All Dominant.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He made the heavens and earth with truth. He rolls the night around the day and He rolls the day around the night and He has employed the sun and the moon into service. Each moves to an appointed term. Do you hear? He is the Dignified, the Forgiving

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He has made you of a single soul then He made its mate from that and sent down for you eight pairs of cattle. He makes you in the wombs of your mothers, first in one pattern then in another, in threefold darkness. This is Allah your Lord, His is the kingdom. None is to be worshipped, besides Him, then where are you turning away?

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If you be ungrateful, then undoubtedly, Allah is independent of you, and He likes not the ungratefulness of His bondmen, but if you be thankful, then He likes it for you. And no soul-bearing burden will bear the burden of another. Then you are to return to your Lord, and He shall inform you of what you used to do. Surely, He knows the secrets of the hearts.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when any trouble touches man, he calls upon his Lord leaning towards Him, then when Allah grants him any favour from Himself, he forgets what he called for before, and begins to assign peers to Allah so that he may lead astray from His way. Say you, 'carry on a little with your infidelity, undoubtedly, you are among the men of the Hell.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): will he who passes the hours of the night in devoted obedience, prostrating and standing fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of His Lord (be like dis-obedient)? Say you, 'Are those who know equal to those who know not'? Only those who are endued with understanding receive admonition.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you. O My Bondmen', who believe, fear your Lord. There is good for those who have done good in this world. And Allah's earth is spacious. The steadfast shall only be fully rewarded without measure.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you; 'I have been commanded to worship Allah being purely His devotee'.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'And I have been commanded to submit first'.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'suppose if I may commit disobedience then I too fear the torment of a great day from my Lord'

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'I worship Allah only being purely His devotee'

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'Worship you what you like besides Him'. Say you, 'complete loss is for those who have lost their own souls and their households on the Day of Judgement. Yes, 'that is indeed an evident loss'.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): There are mountains of fire over them and beneath them mountains. With this, Allah warns His bondmen O My bondmen! fear you Me'.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who saved themselves from worshipping idols and turned towards Allah in repentance, for them are glad tidings. So give glad tidings to My those bondmen.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who listen to the word attentively and follow the best thereof. It is they whom Allah has guided and it is they who possess wisdom.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Will he then against whom the sentence of torment is decreed be equal to those who are delivered? Will you then rescue one deserting fire from your guidance?

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But those who fear their Lord, for them are lofty chambers, built over them lofty chambers, beneath which rivers flow. The promise of Allah, Allah breaks not His promise.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have you not seen that Allah has sent down water from the sky and then made springs in the earth thereof, then He causes to grow therewith crops of diverse colours, thereafter it dries up and see you that it turns yellow, then He breaks it into small pieces? Undoubtedly, in it is a reminder for men of understanding.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Will he whose heart Allah has opened for Islam so that he is upon a light from his Lord be like him who is hard heartened? Woe, then, is to those whose hearts are hardened from the remembrance of Allah. They are in evident error.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah has sent the best Book that from beginning to the end is alike (in beauty and fairness), having two fold descriptions (promise of reward and threat of punishment) at which do shudder the skins of those who fear their Lord, then their skins and hearts soften inclining towards the remembrance of God. This is the guidance of Allah He guides therewith whom He pleases. And he whom Allah -causes to go astray, there is none to guide him.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Will he, then, who will make his face a shield for the great torment on the Day of Resurrection be like him who has been delivered? And it will be said to the oppressors, taste your earnings.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those before them belied so torment came upon them whence they knew not.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore Allah made them taste humiliation in the life of the world and the torment of the Hereafter is the greatest. What a good thing it would have been if they knew.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We have narrated in this Quran all types of examples for the people in order that they may take heed.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The Quran in Arabic language wherein there is no crookedness in order that they may fear.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah sets an example, a servant belonging to several rude masters and one belonging solely to one master. Are they both equal in condition? All praise to Allah, but most of them know not.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, you are to die, and they are too to die.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then on the Day of Resurrection you will dispute before your Lord.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who is then more unjust than he, who fabricates a lie against Allah and belies the truth, when it comes to him? Is there not an abode in the Hell for the infidels?

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And he who has come with truth and those who confirmed it, they are the God fearing.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For them is what they desire with their Lord. This is the reward of the righteous.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So that Allah may remove from them the worst that they did and re-compense them with their reward for the best of their actions that they used to do.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Is Allah not sufficient for His bondmen? And they frighten you with those besides Him. And whom Allah lets astray, for him there is no guide.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whom Allah guides, for him there is none to mislead is not Allah the Honourable, the Master of retribution?

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth they will then necessarily say, 'Allah'. Say you, 'tell me then that those whom you worship besides Allah, if Allah desired any affliction for me shall they then remove His affliction? Or if He desires mercy for me, could they withhold His mercy? Say you, 'Allah is enough for me', in Him the trusting one put their trust'.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, `O my people', continue acting in your own way, I do my work, soon you will come to know.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): On whom comes a torment that will humiliate him and on whom descends a torment that will abide.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have sent down upon you the Book for the guidance of mankind with truth. Then whosoever got the way, that is for his own good and whoso went astray, he went astray for his own loss. And you are not responsible for them.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah takes away the souls at the time of their death and of those who die not, during their sleep, then He withholds that against which He has decreed death and sends back the other till an appointed time. Undoubtedly in it are signs for those who reflect.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have they taken some intercessors besides Allah? Say you, what! 'Even though they own nothing, nor they do understand'.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you; 'all intercession belongs to Allah'. 'For Him is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth, then you are to return to Him'.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter shrink, and when those besides Him are mentioned, henceforth they rejoice.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Submit you, O! Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, knower of the hidden and the open, You alone will decide between your bondmen concerning that in which they used to differ.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If the wrongdoers had all that is in the earth and the like thereof in addition to it, they would have offered all of it as ransom from the evil torment on the Day of Judgement. But there appeared to them from Allah that which they never thought of.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And their own earned evils became apparent to them and they were encircled by that which they used to mock at.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when any trouble touches man, he calls on Us, then when We grant him any favour from Us, he says, 'I have got it because of a certain knowledge.' Nay! It is only a trial, but most of them know not.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So have said those who were before them, but all that they had earned did not avail them.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So the evils of their earnings overtook them, and those who are unjust among them, they too shall be over taken by the evils of their earnings and they can not go out of control.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do they not know that Allah enlarges the provision for whomsoever He likes and restricts it for whomsoever He likes? Undoubtedly, in it are signs for the believers.

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'O My bondmen who have committed excesses against their own souls 'despair not of the mercy of Allah' Undoubtedly, Allah forgives all sins, Verily He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And turn towards your Lord and submit yourselves to Him, before there comes to you the torment and then you may not be helped.

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And follow the best, which has been sent to you from your Lord, before the torment overtakes you suddenly when you know not.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Lest a soul should say, 'Ah-alas'. on the errors which I committed regarding Allah, and undoubtedly I used to scoff.'

57.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or it should say, had Allah guided me I would have been among those who are fearful.

58.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or it should say, 'when it sees the torment, had there been a return for me I would have been doing good'.

59.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Yes, why not, undoubtedly, My signs came to you but you belied then and waxed proud and you were infidel.

60.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And on the day of Judgement, you will see those who fabricated lie against Allah that their faces are black. Is there not in Hell an abode for the proud?

61.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah will save them who fear Him to their place of deliverance. Torment shall not touch them nor shall they grieve.

62.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is the Creator of every thing and He has authority over every thing.

63.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For Him is the keys of the heavens and the earth. And those who rejected the signs of Allah, they are the people who are in loss.

64.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say, you, 'Do you then say to me to worship other than Allah. O! You ignorants.'

65.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, it has been revealed to you, and to those before you that O listeners! if you associate other gods with Allah, then surely, your all actions shall go vain and you shall necessarily remain in loss.

66.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nay, but worship Allah and be among the gratefuls.

67.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And "they esteemed not Allah as was due to Him and He will roll up the. Entire earth on the Day of Judgement and all the heavens shall be rolled up by His Authority. And He is Sanctified and Exalted from their association.

68.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the Trumpet shall be blown, and then whoever is in the heavens and whoever is in the earth will swoon but whom Allah wills, then it shall be blown for the second time, henceforth they shall stand looking on.

69.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the earth shall glitter with the light of her Lord and the Book will be laid and the Prophets shall be brought and witnesses too, (this prophet and his followers will be witnesses against them) and true judgement will be given between them and they shall not be treated unjustly.

70.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And every soul shall be paid in full for their doings and He knows well what they used to do.

71.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The infidels shall be driven towards Hell in troops. Until when they shall reach to it, its gates will be opened and its warder will say to them, 'Did not come to you from amongst you the Messengers who recited to you verses of your Lord and warned you of the meeting of this Day of yours'? They will say, 'Why not', but the words of torment has been justified on the infidels.

72.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It shall be said to them, 'Enter the gates of Hell to abide therein, what is an evil destination of the proud.

73.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who feared their Lord, their carriages shall be escorted to Heaven in troops. Until when they shall reach there, and its gates shall be opened and it warders will say to them, 'peace be upon you', excellent were you, so enter the paradise to abide for ever'.

74.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they will say, 'all praise to Allah Who has made good His promise to us, and made us inherit this land, so that we' may dwell in the paradise wherever we please, what is an excellent reward of the workers.

75.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne on all sides sanctifying their 'Lord with His praise, and true judgement will be pronounced between them and it will be said, 'All praise to Allah, the Lord of the entire world.

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): HA-MIM.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The sending down of this 'Book is from Allah, the Honourable, the Knowing.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The Forgiver of sins, Accepter of penitence, severe in torment, Possessor of plenty rewards. There is no god be sides Him. Towards Him is the return.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): None disputes about the signs of Allah but the infidels. Let not then, O listener, their swaggering about in the cities deceive you.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Before them, the people of Nuh and other groups after them belied, and every nation aimed that they may seize their Messenger, and disputed with false arguments that they may relent the truth, so I seized them: How then was My torment?

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And thus the word of your Lord has been proved against the infidels that they are the inmates of the Fire.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who bear the Throne and those around it sanctify their Lord with praise and believe in Him and beg forgiveness for the Muslims, O' our Lord; You comprehend every thing in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who repented and followed Your way and save them from the torment of Hell'

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O our Lord! Admit them into gardens of habitation which you have promised them, as well as those who are righteous of their fathers and wives and children. Undoubtedly, You are the Honourable, the Wise

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And save them from the adversity of sins, and whomsoever you save from the adversity of sin that day then no doubt, You have shown mercy upon him. And this is the great triumph.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who disbelieved shall be informed that of course the aversion of Allah to you is greater than your own aversion to yourselves to day, when you were called towards the faith and you disbelieved.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They shall say, 'O our Lord, You have caused us to die twice and has given us life twice, now we confess our sins. Is there then any way of getting out of the Fire?

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This happened because, when only one Allah was proclaimed, you disbelieved, but when partners were associated to Him, you believed. Therefore, the command is for Allah Who is the Highest, the Greatest.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He Who shows you His signs and sends down for you provision from the sky. And none receives admonitions but he who repents.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, serve only Allah devoted purely to Him even though the infidels may take it as bad.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Exalted in ranks, Possessor of the Throne, He casts the spirit of faith (the revelation) by His Command upon whomsoever He will of His bondmen, that he may warn of the Day of meeting.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when they will fully appear; nothing of theirs shall be hidden from Allah. Whose is the Kingdom to day? Of one Allah, All Dominant.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): To day, every soul shall be recompensed of his earnings there is no injustice to any one today. Undoubtedly Allah is swift in reckoning.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And warn them of that Approaching Day of Calamity when the hearts will reach to the throats full of grief. The unjust shall have neither friend nor any intercessor whose request may be acceded to.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah knows the treacherous eyes and what is concealed in the breasts.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah decides with truth. But those whom they worship beside Him decide nothing. Undoubtedly Allah is All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have they not traveled in the earth, so that they may see how has been the end of those before them? They were greater than them in strength and in marks, they left in the earth; Yet Allah seized them for their sins. And there was none to save them from Allah.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This because their Messengers came to them with bright Signs, but they disbelieved, so Allah seized them. Undoubtedly Allah is Mighty, Severe in punishment.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We sent Musa with our signs and a clear testimony,

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): To Firawn (Pharaoh) and Haman and Qaroon (Korah) but they said, "He is a magician, a great liar".

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when he brought to them the truth from Us, they said, 'slay the sons of those who believed with him and let their women alive'. And the plot of the infidels is nothing but going astray.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Firawn said, 'leave me that I may kill Musa and let him call his Lord. I fear lest he should change your religion or he may cause to appear disorder in the earth'.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Musa said, 'I take refuge with my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant who believes not in the nay of Reckoning.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And a Muslim from amongst the people of Firawn who used to hide his faith said, 'Do you slay a man because he says, 'my Lord is Allah', and undoubtedly he has brought to you bright signs from your Lord?' And if he says wrong then the curse of his lie is upon him; but if he is truthful then some of that which he promises you with shall befall you. Undoubtedly Allah gives not the way to him who is transgressor and a big liar.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O my people, 'yours is the Kingdom today, you have dominance in this land. But who will save us from the torment of Allah if it comes upon us? Firawn said, 'I show you only that which I see and I tell you only that which is the way of goodness'.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the believer said, 'O my people', I fear for you a day like the day of former groups.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): As had to face the people of Nooh and Aad and Samud and those after them. And Allah wishes not injustice for His bondmen.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And O my people', I fear for you the Day of Calling and Crying.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A day when you shall flee turning your backs, there shall be none to save you from Allah; and he whom Allah sends astray, for him there is no guide.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'And undoubtedly Yusuf came to you before this with bright signs, but you remained in doubt about that which he brought to you, until he died, and you said, 'never shall Allah send any Messenger after him. Thus, Allah sends astray him who is extravagant, and a doubter.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who dispute concerning the signs of Allah without any authority is having come to them. It is greatly hateful in the sight of Allah and in the sight of the believers. Thus, Allah seals up the heart of every proud and contumacious person.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Firawn said, 'O Hamman', build for me a lofty palace that I may reach the ways.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): (Which ways) the ways of the heavens, so that I may peep at the God of Musa and undoubtedly, I think that he is liar. And thus his evil deed made to look fair in the eyes of Firawn and he was barred from the way. And the plot of Firawn was to be ruined only.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the man who believed said, 'O my people', follow me, I will guide you to the good way.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O my people; the life of this world is only a temporary enjoyment, and the Hereafter is certainly the home for permanent residence.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whoso does an evil deed, shall be recompensed only with the like of it and whoso does good work whether male or female and be a Muslim, then they shall enter the Paradise and they shall be provided therein without count.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O my people', what happened to me that I call you towards deliverance while you call me towards the Fire.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): You call me towards this that I should disbelieve in Allah and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, while I invite you towards the Honourable, the Great Forgiver.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is proved itself that to which you call me, is of no use anywhere neither in the world nor in the Hereafter; and that our return is towards Allah and that the transgressors, they are the inmates of the Fire.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So soon, the time comes that you shall remember what I am saying to you. And I entrust my affairs to Allah. Undoubtedly Allah sees all His bondmen.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then Allah saved him from the evils of their plot and an evil torment surrounded the people of Firawn.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The Fire, they are exposed thereto morning and evening, and the day when the Hour shall come, it shall be ordered, cause the people of Firawn to enter the most grievous torment.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when they will dispute with one another in the Fire, then the weak shall say to those who waxed proud, we were your followers, will you then get any portion of the Fire curtailed from us?

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who waxed proud said, 'we are all in the Fire Undoubtedly, Allah has already judged between His bondmen.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those in the Fire shall say to the guards of the Hell, pray to your Lord that He may lighten for us a day of torment.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'Did not your Messenger use to bring to you bright signs'? They said, 'why not', they said, 'then you your selves pray'. And the praying of the infidels is not but in wandering.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): No doubt, We shall certainly help Our Messengers and the believers in the life of the world and on the day witnesses shall stand forth.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when to the unjust people their excuses will not profit, and for them is the curse and for them is the evil abode.

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We bestowed guidance to Musa and made the children of Israel the inheritors of the Book.

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A guidance and admonition for the men of understanding.

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore O beloved, 'be patient, no doubt, the promise of Allah is true and beg forgiveness for the sins of your owns, and celebrate Sanctity of your Lord praising Him morning and evening.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who dispute concerning the signs of Allah without any authority they may have got, there is nothing in their hearts but an ambition of greatness to which they shall not reach, so seek you refuge in Allah. Undoubtedly, He sees, Hears.

57.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Of course, the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of the people know not.

58.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the blind and the seeing are not equal, and neither those who have believed and have done good equal to the evil doers. How little do you reflect?

59.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, the Hour is certainly to come, there is no doubt in it, but most people believe not.

60.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And your Lord said, 'Pray to Me, I shall acknowledge your call. Undoubtedly those who are too proud to worship Me, soon will enter the Hell despised.

61.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is He who made for you night that you may get rest in it and made the day enabling you to see. Undoubtedly, Allah is gracious to mankind but most men are ungrateful.

62.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That is Allah, your Lord the Creator of everything, None is to be worshipped save He. So whither, are you straying away?

63.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Thus, stray away those who reject the signs of Allah.

64.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is He who made the earth for you a resting place and the heaven as a roof and shaped you, then made your shapes nice and provided you with good things This is Allah your Lord. So blessed is Allah, the Lord of the entire world.

65.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He is Ever-Living none is to be worshipped save He; so worship Him being devoted purely to Him. All praise is to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

66.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'I have been forbidden to worship those whom you worship beside Allah since clear signs have come to me from my Lord and I have been commanded to submit myself to the Lord of the worlds.

67.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He it is Who made you from dust, then from sperm drop, then from a clot of blood, then He brings you forth as an infant, then He causes you to live so that you may attain to your maturity then that you may become old, and some of you are caused to die before and that you may reach to an appointed promise and that you may learn.

68.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He is He who gives life and causes death; and when He decrees a thing, He says to it only, 'Be', hence it becomes.

69.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have you not seen those who dispute in the signs of Allah? Whither are they turned away?

70.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who belied the Book and that with which We sent Our Messengers soon they shall know.

71.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When the iron collars shall be around their necks and chains too, they shall be dragged;

72.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): into the boiling water, then they shall be burnt in the Fire.

73.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then it will be said to them, 'where went those whom you used to associate,

74.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Against Allah. They will say, 'they are lost away from us, but rather we never worshipped any thing before. Thus, Allah leads astray the infidels.

75.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is because you rejoiced in the earth without right and because you behaved boastfully.

76.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Enter the gates of Hell to remain there in forever, and what is an evil abode of the proud.

77.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So be you patient, no doubt, the promise of Allah is true, then whether We let you see something of what We have promised them or We cause you to die before, in any case they are to return to us.

78.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We sent many Messengers before you, of them, there are some whose story We have narrated to you, and there are some whose story We have not narrated to you, and it is not for any Messenger that he should bring any sign without Allah's permission, but when the command of Allah will come, the matter shall be decided with truth, and then the men of falsehood shall lose there.

79.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is He Who made for you the cattle that you may ride on some of them and some of them you may eat.

80.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And there are many benefits for you in them and that you may attain to the desires of your hearts on their backs and on them and on boats you ride.

81.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And He shows you His signs, and then which of the signs of Allah will you deny?

82.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have they not traveled in the earth that they may behold how has been the end of those before them? They were more numerous than these, and stronger in might and the traces in the earth, but what did they avail of that which they earned.

83.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So when, their Messengers brought to them clear arguments they remained joyous the wordily knowledge which they had and what they mocked at recoiled on them.

84.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when they saw Our torment said, We believe in only one Allah and we deny all that which we used to associate with Him.

85.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But their belief was of no use to them when they had seen Our torment. This is Allah's law, which has been in regard to His bondmen. And the infidels remained in loss there.

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): HA-MIM.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is a sending down from the Most Affectionate, the Merciful.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is a Book whose verses have been fully explained, an Arabic Quran for a people of understanding.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Bearing glad tidings and warning. But most of them turned away their faces and listen not.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they said, 'Our hearts are in covers from that to which you invite us and in our ears are plugs and between us and you there is a curtain, therefore you do your work and we are doing ours.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'In being a human being I am indeed like you, it is revealed to me that your God is one God, so be straight before Him and beg forgiveness from Him. And woe be to the associators

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who do not pay poor due (Zakat) and they deny the Hereafter.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who believe and do good works, there is for them endless reward.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'Do you indeed disbelieve in Him who made the earth in two days? And do you set up equals to Him' That is the Lord of the entire world.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And He placed therein anchors of mountains rising above it and put blessings therein and ordained therein provisions for its inhabitants all this in four days, complete this for the enquirers.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then He turned towards the heaven and it was a smoke. Then He said to it and to the earth, 'come both of you willingly or unwillingly. They both submitted,' we have come willingly.'

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then He completed them as seven heavens in two days and He sent to each heaven the commands of its own function. And We adorned the lower heaven with lamps and for protection. This is the decree of the Honourable. The All Knowing.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But if they turn their faces then say you, 'I warn, you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt, which overtook Aad and Thamud.'

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When Messengers came to them from before them and behind them saying, 'worship none but Allah'. They said, 'had our Lord so wished, He would have sent down angels, so we disbelieve in what you have been sent with.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And as to those who were Aad, they waxed proud in the earth without right and said, 'who is mightier in strength than us'. Did they not know that Allah who created them is mightier than they in strength? But they continued to deny Our signs.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We therefore sent upon them a furious cold wind in the days of their misfortune so that We make them taste the torment of humiliation in the life of the world. And undoubtedly, there is great humiliation in the torment of the Hereafter and they shall not be helped.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And As For Thamud, We guided them but they preferred blindness to the guidance, therefore the thunder of a humiliating torment overtook them, the punishment of their doings.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We saved those who believed and used to fear.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And on the day when the enemies of Allah shall be driven towards the Fire, then those who will come first shall be stopped till those coming next should meet them.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Till when they will reach there, their ears and their eyes and their faces will bear witness against their doings.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they will say to their skins, 'Why did you bear witness against us? They will say, 'Allah made us to speak, He who bestowed speaking power to every thing and He created you the first time and towards Him you are to return.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And where you would have gone hiding yourselves from Him lest your ears and your eyes and your skins should bear witness against you, hut you had already taken it for granted that Allah knows not much of your doings

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is your conception, which you formed for your Lord, and it has ruined you, so now you are amongst the losers.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then if they endure, the fire is their destination. And they beg to please Allah, then none would accept their pleasing.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We appoint for them some companions, who made to appear fair seeming to them what is before them and what behind them, and the sentence was justified against them along with those groups that had already gone before them from amongst the jinn and mankind. Undoubtedly, they were losers.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the infidels said, 'listen not to this Quran and make absurd noise therein, haply you may over come.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, most certainly We shall necessarily make the infidels to taste a severe torment. And undoubtedly, We shall recompense them for the worst of their deeds.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is the recompense of the enemies of Allah, the Fire wherein they are to abide forever' as the punishment for that they used to deny Our signs.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the infidels said, 'O Our Lord', show us those who misled us both Jinn and men, that we may put them under our feet, so that they may remain among the lowest

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who said, 'our. Lord is Allah then remain firm on it, the angels descend upon them, saying, 'fear not, nor grieve and be glad with the paradise which you were promised.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We are your friends in the life of this world and in the Hereafter. And for you therein is that which your soul may desire, and for you therein is that which you may ask for.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): An entertainment from the Forgiving, the Merciful.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And who is better in speech than him who invites towards Allah and does righteousness and says, 'I am muslim'.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And good and evil will not be equal O listener,' repel the evil with good, then he between whom and you there was enmity will become as though he was your warm friend.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And this wealth is granted not but to those who are steadfast and it is granted not but to the owner of great fortune.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If any provocation of the devil reaches you, then seek refuge in Allah. Undoubtedly, He is the Hearer, the Knower.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And among His signs are the night and the day and the sun and the moon. Prostrate not before the sun nor the moon and prostrate before Allah Who has created them if you are His bondman.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But if they wax proud, then those who are with your Lord sanctify Him night and day and they weary not. [^] (SAJDA

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And of His signs is that you see the earth lying worthless, but when We sent down rain to it, it became fresh and mellow and grew. Undoubtedly He, Who gave life to it, shall necessarily give life to the dead. No doubt, He can do every thing.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly those who seek crooked ways in Our signs are not hidden from Us. Is he then who shall be thrown in the Fire better or he who shall come secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do what you please; undoubtedly He is seeing your work.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who denied the reminder when it came to them, (ask not the condition of their misery) and undoubtedly it is an esteemed Book.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): There is no approach of falsehood to it either from before or from behind it. It is a sending down from One All Wise, All Praised.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nothing will be said to you, but only that which was said to the Messengers before you. Undoubtedly, your Lord is Forgiving and Master of painful torment.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if We had made it a Quran in a foreign tongue, they surely would have said, Why not its verses have been made clear? What, a book in foreign tongue and the Prophet Arabian. Say you, 'that is a guidance and a cure for the believers.' And those who believe not, in their ears is a plug and to them it is a blindness. They are like those. Who are called from a far off place.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We bestowed a Book to Musa, but differences were created there in. And if a word had not gone before from your Lord, then henceforth the matter would have been decided between them. And undoubtedly, they are surely in a confusing doubt about it.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whoso does righteousness it is for his own good and whoso does evil, it is for his own bad. And your Lord is not at all unjust to His bondmen.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The knowledge of the Hour is referred to Him alone. And no fruit comes forth from its sheath, and neither any female bears and nor brings forth but with His knowledge. And the day when He will call them, "Where are My associates"? They will say, 'We have already proclaimed to you that there is no witness among us.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those, whom they used to worship before, were lost from them and they have known for certain that they have no place of escape.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Man tires not of praying for good and if any evil touches him then he loses hope, becoming desperate.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if We make him taste of mercy from Us after the affliction that had touched him, then he will say, 'this is my own, and in my opinion the Hour will not come'. And even if I be returned to my Lord, necessarily, for me there is good with Him. Then surely We shall tell the infidels all that whatever they did, and We shall certainly make them taste severe torment.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when We bestow favour on man, he turns his face and withdraws towards himself and when evil touches him then he is of prolonged prayer.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'well tell you if this Quran is from Allah and yet you reject it, who is then more astray than one who is in a far off opposition.

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Soon, We shall show them Our signs in the entire world and in their own selves, till it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. Is it not sufficient that your Lord is witness over all things?

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Listen, they are surely in doubt concerning the meeting with their Lord, Hearken! He encompasses everything

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ha-Mim.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ain-Seen-Qaf.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Likewise reveals to you and to those before you, Allah the Honourable. The Wise.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For Him is whatever is in the heaven and whatever is in the earth. And He is the Exalted, the Grand.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is well night that the heavens may rend from above themselves and the angels sanctify their Lord with His praise and beg forgiveness for the people of earth. Hearken, Allah, He is the Forgiver, the Merciful

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who have taken others as patrons beside Allah, they are under the sight of Allah and you are not responsible for them

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And likewise We revealed to you a Quran in Arabic so that you may warn thereby the mother of all towns the Meccans and those who live around it and you may warn them of a Day of Assembly wherein there is no doubt. A party is in the paradise and a party is in the Hell.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And had Allah willed He would have made them a people of one faith, but Allah admits into His mercy whomsoever He pleases. And as for the unjust, they have neither any friend nor any helper

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have they taken others as patrons beside Allah? But it is Allah, He is the Patron and He will give life to the dead and He can do every thing

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In whatever you differ, the decision thereof is with Allah. This is Allah, my Lord, in Him I put my trust-and I turn towards Him.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The Maker of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you pairs of your own selves and male and female cattle, whereby He spreads your race. Nothing is Like Him, and He is the All-Hearing, All-seeing.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For Him are the keys of the Heavens and the earth. He expands the provision for whomsoever He pleases and straitens too. Undoubtedly. He knows everything.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He has directed you to the religion, which He enjoined upon Nuh and that which We revealed to you and that which We enjoined upon Ibrahim, Musa and Isa saying, "set the religion right and cause not dissension therein. Very hard upon the polytheists is that to which you call them. And Allah chooses for His nearness whomsoever He pleases and guides to Himself him who turns towards Him.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they caused not dissension but after the knowledge had come to them on account of mutual jealousy. And had not a saying of your Lord gone forth for an appointed term, the matter. Would have been surely decided among them long ago. And undoubtedly, those who have inherited the Book after them are in a deceitful doubt regarding it.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For this then, call you and remain steadfast as you have been commanded and follow not their desires and say, "I believe in whatever Book Allah has sent down and I have been commanded that I may do justice between you. Allah is our Lord and the Lord of you all. For us are our deeds and for you are your deeds. There is no argument between us and you. Allah will gather us together, and towards Him is the return.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who dispute concerning Allah after that the muslims have already accepted His Call, their argument is purely unstable in the sight of Allah and upon them is the wrath and for them is the severe torment.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is Who has sent down the Book with the truth and the balance of justice. And what shall make you know that perhaps the Hour may be near.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who believe not therein seek to hasten it, and those who believe therein are fearing of it and know that undoubtedly, it is the truth, Beware! Verily, those who are in doubt concerning the Hour are indeed in a far-off error.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is Gentle towards His bondmen. He provides for whomsoever He pleases, and He is the Powerful. Honourable.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whosoever desires till age of the Hereafter. We give an increase in his till age, and whosoever desires the till age of the world, We shall give him somewhat thereof and in the Hereafter he shall have no share.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or for them there are some associates who have made for them a religion that for which Allah has given no leave. And had there not been the promise of a decision, it would have been decided between them here. And undoubtedly, for the unjust people is a painful torment.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): You shall see the wrongdoers fearful on account of their earnings and it is sure to be-fall them. And those who believed and did good deeds are in the meadows of the Paradise. They shall have with their Lord whatever they will desire. This is the great grace.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is that of which Allah gives the glad-tidings to His bondmen who believed and did good deeds. Say you, "I ask not of you any wage for it but affection in respect of kinship". And whoever does a good-deed, We shall increase to him good in respect thereof. Undoubtedly, Allah is Forgiving, Appreciating.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or they say, "He has forged a lie against Allah." But if Allah wills, He may set a seal of His Mercy and safely upon your heart. And Allah wipes out the falsehood and establishes the truth with His Words. Undoubtedly, He knows what is inside the breasts.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it is He Who accepts the repentance from His bondmen and overlooks the faults and He knows what you do.
