26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And He responds to those who have believed and have done good deeds and gives them more reward out of His grace. And for the infidels there is a severe torment.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And had Allah expanded the provisions of all His bondmen, they would have necessarily then spread mischief in the earth, but He sends down according to a measure as He pleases, undoubtedly, He is Aware of His bond­men, Sees them.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it is He Who sends down rain after they have despaired, and spreads out His mercy. And He is the Protector, Praiseworthy.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and of whatever moving creatures He has spread forth in them. And He has the power to gather them together when He pleases.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whatever affliction reached you is due to what Your hands have earned; and He pardons much.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you cannot go out of His control in the earth, and you have against Allah, neither a friend nor a helper.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And of His signs are vessels running in the sea like hills.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If He pleases, He may cause the wind to become still, so that they stand still on its back. Undoubtedly, therein are signs for every one most patient and grateful.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or He may destroy them on account of the sins of the people and may pardon much of their sins.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who dispute in Our Signs should know that for them there is no place of escape.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whatever you have been given is only a temporary provision of this living world and that which is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who have believed and trust their Lord.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who avoid heinous sins and indecencies and, when they are angry, they forgive.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who obeyed the command of their Lord and established prayer and their affairs are decided by mutual consultation and they spend something out of Our provision in Our way.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who, when insolence reaches them, take revenge.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the recompense of evil is evil the like of it, but whoso forgives and puts the things right his reward is with Allah. Undoubtedly, He loves not the unjust.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, whoso took revenge after being victim of oppression; there is no way of blame against them.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The blame is only against them who oppress mankind and rebel in the earth without right. For them is the painful torment.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But whoever indeed preserved and forgave, most certainly, then these are the affairs of determination.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whomsoever Allah leads astray, he has no friend against Allah. And you will see the oppressors when they will see the torment saying, Is there anyway to return'

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you will see them that they are presented before Fire dejected on account of disgrace, they see with veiled eyes. And the believers will say, 'undoubtedly, the losers are those who have lost their souls and their families on the Day of Resurrection'. Beware! No doubt, the unjust are in lasting torment.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they have no friend to help them against Allah and whomsoever Allah leads astray; there is no way for him.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Obey the commands of your Lord before the coming of the Day that is not to be fumed back from Allah. You will have no refuge that day, nor you can dare to deny.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But if they turn their faces, then We have not sent you as a guardian over them. There is nothing on you but to convey the (the Message) And when We give man the taste of any mercy from Us, he becomes happy over it. But if any evil befalls them because of what their hands have sent forth, then the man is most ungrateful.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For Allah is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth, He creates whatever He likes. He bestows daughters on whomsoever He likes and He bestows sons on whomsoever He likes.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or He mixes both, the sons and the daughters, and He makes whomsoever He likes barren. Undoubtedly, He is knowing, Authoritative.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it is not fit for any man that Allah should speak to him but through revelation or that the man may be at the other side of the veil of grandeur. Or He may send any angel that he may reveal by His command what He pleases undoubtedly He is High, Wise

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And likewise We have revealed to you an invigorative thing by Our command. You did not know the Book before it nor the details of the laws of religion, yes, We made it a light whereby We guide such of Our bondmen as We please. And undoubtedly, you most certainly guides to the straight path.

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The path of Allah, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Do you listen? All affairs return to Allah only

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ha-Mim.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By the Book luminous.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We have sent it down an Arabic Quran that you may understand.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if you ask them, "who has made the heavens and the earth" they will necessarily say, "the Esteemed One the All-Knowing made them.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He, Who made the earth a bed for you and made pathways therein for you that you, may be guided.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And He, Who sent down water from the sky according to an estimate, and We there by give life to a dead city and thus you, will be brought forth.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And who made all the pairs and made for you carriages from boats and cattle.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That you may sit rightly on their backs, and then you remember the favours of your Lord when you are rightly seated thereon and say, Sanctity is to Him Who has subjected this carriage to us and this was not controllable by our power.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly' We are to return to our Lord.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they have appointed for Him a portion of His bondmen. Undoubtedly, man is clearly ungrateful.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Has He taken for Him daughters of His Creations and has chosen you with sons?

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when any of them is given the glad-tidings of that whose worth he has already described for the Most Affectionate, his face remains darkened the entire day and he endures grief.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And what! One who is reared in ornaments, and speaks not clearly in altercation?

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they have appointed the angles who are bondmen of the Most Affectionate, females. Were they present at the time of their creation? Now their evidence shall be recorded and they shall be questioned.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they said, 'Had the Most Affectionate so willed, we would not have worshipped them? They know nothing about its reality, they are only guessing.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or have We given any Book to them before this to which they hold?

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But rather they said, 'We found our forefathers on one religion and we are going on their footsteps'.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And likewise when We sent any warner in any city before you, the affluent thereof said, 'indeed we found our forefathers on one religion and we are following their footsteps.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The prophet said, 'and what! Even though I may bring to you a better guidance than you found your fathers upon?' They said, 'we deny that you are sent with?'

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, We took vengeance upon them. Behold then, how was the end of the beliers?

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when Ibrahim said to his father and his people, 'I am quit of what you worship'?

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Except Him who created, He will, and me necessarily, guide me soon.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And he let the word remain in his posterity that haply they may desist.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But rather I gave them and their fathers wordily enjoyments, until there came to them the truth and a Messenger explaining clearly.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when the truth came to them, they said, 'this is a magic, and we are denier of it.'

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they said, 'why has not this Quran sent down upon any great man of the two cities'?

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do they distribute the mercy of your Lord? We have distributed their livelihood among them in the life of the world and have raised some of them over others in degrees, that in between them one may laugh at the other. And the mercy of your Lord is better than that they amass.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And had it not been that all mankind would become of the same faith, We would have surely made for those who disbelieve in the All Affectionate, roofs of silver for their houses and stairs whereon they ascend.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And for their houses silver doors and silvers couches upon which they recline,

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And various types of adornments. And all this is, it is only a provision of the life of this world. And the Here after with your Lord is for the God-fearing.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whoso blinds himself from the remembrance of the All Affectionate, We assign to him a devil that he may remain his companion.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, the devil hinders them from the way and they imagine that they are rightly guided.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Until when the infidels will come to Us, he will say to his devil, Ah! Would there had been between you and me a distance of east and west! What an evil companion is he,

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you shall never be benefited by it today, since you have done wrong that you all are associated in the torment.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Will you then make the deaf to hear, or will you guide the blind and those who are in clear error?

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And even though We take you away, We shall surely take vengeance on them.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or We show you that We promised them for We have great power.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, hold you fast to that which has been revealed to you. Undoubtedly, you are on the straight-path.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, it (The Quran) is an eminence for you and for your people, and soon you will be questioned.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And ask those of Our Messengers whom We sent before you, 'Did We appoint some other gods besides the All-Affectionate to be worshipped'?

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We sent Musa with Our signs to Firawn and his chiefs, and he said, 'undoubtedly, I am the Messenger of Him Who is the Lord of the entire world.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when he brought Our signs to them, hence they began to laugh at them.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We showed them no signs but it was greater than its previous one and We seized them in misery in order that they may desist.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they said, 'O magician! 'pray your Lord for us because of His convenant which is with you, undoubtedly, we shall come to guidance'.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when We removed from them the misery henceforth they broke the convenant.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Firawn proclaimed among his people, 'O my people! Is not the Kingdom of Egypt for me and these streams that flow beneath me? Do you not then see?

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or am I better than this man who is contemptible and seems not to be clear in speech?

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Why, then, bracelets of gold have been bestowed on him or angels come along with him that they may remain with him?

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he befooled his people and they obeyed him. Undoubtedly, they were the people disobedient.

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when they did that upon which Our anger came on them, We took vengeance on them and We drowned them all.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We made them a story of the past and an example for the coming generations.

57.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when the example of the son of Maryam is narrated, henceforth your people begin to laugh thereat.

58.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And say 'are our gods better or he? They said not this to you but for quarreling, Nay, but they are a people quarrel-some.

59.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He was not but a bondman whom We favoured and made him a strange example for the children of Israel.

60.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If We wished, We would have peopled angels in the earth in place of you.

61.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, Isa is the news of the Hour, therefore never doubt about the Hour and follow Me. This is the straight path.

62.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And let never the devil hinder you. Undoubtedly, he is your manifest enemy.

63.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when Isa brought bright signs, he said, 'I have come to you with wisdom and in order to make clear to you some of that wherein you differ, therefore fear Allah and obey my command.'

64.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, Allah is my Lord and is your Lord, therefore, worship Him. This is the straight path.

65.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But the parties differed among themselves. Therefore, woe is to those who are unjust because of the torment of a painful day.

66.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What they are waiting for, but for the Hour that it should come upon them of a sudden while they know not?

67.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Fast friends shall be foes to one another on that day but the God-fearing.

68.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It will be said to them, O My Bondmen! there is no fear for you this day nor shall you grieve.

69.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who believed in Our signs and were Muslims.

70.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Enter you the Paradise, you and your wives joyfully and honorably.

71.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): There shall be passed around them the cups of gold and goblets and therein shall be whatsoever soul desires and eyes delight in, and therein you shall remain for ever.

72.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And this is Paradise to which you have been made heirs because of your actions.

73.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therein you have abundant fruits that you may eat.

74.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, the culprits are to abide forever in the torment of the Hell.

75.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That shall never be abated from them and they shall remain there despaired

76.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We wronged them nothing, yes, they were themselves unjust.

77.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will call, O master! 'let your Lord finish with us'. He shall say, 'you are to stay.'

78.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We brought you the truth but the truth is offensive to most of you.

79.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have they determined any affair in their opinion, then We are to determine Our affair?

80.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private counsels? Yes, why not and Our angels are writing present with them.

81.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'if worst come to worst there had been a son to the Most Affectionate, I would have worshipped first'.

82.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Sanctity is to Allah the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne from all those things which they fabricate.

83.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So, leave them that they may talk nonsense and play until they encounter that day of theirs, which they are promised.

84.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And He is the God of the people of heaven, and God of the people of earth. And' He is the Wise, the Knowing.

85.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And blessed is He for Whom is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth and whatever is in between and He has the knowledge of the Hour and you are to return to Him

86.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those whom they worship beside Allah have no power of intercession, yes, those who bear witness to the truth and know have the power of intercession.

87.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If you ask them who created them, they will necessarily say, Allah, then whither they are turning away?

88.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And by the saying of the Messenger, O My Lord, they do not believe.

89.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore overlook them and say, peace: soon they shall l know.

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ha-Mim.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By this luminous Book.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly We sent it down in a blessed night; verily We are to warn.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therein every affair of wisdom is divided.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A command from Us, Verily, We are to send.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A mercy from your Lord, undoubtedly, He, Hears, knows.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatsoever is in between if you are convinced.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): None is to be worshipped but He. He gives life and causes death, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nay, but they are in doubt, playing.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, wait you the day when the sky will bring a clear smoke,

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That it shall cover the people. This is a painful torment.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will say that day, 'O our Lord! Remove from us the torment, We believe'.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whence they are to accept admonition, whereas there has already come a clear Messenger.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then they turned away from him and said, 'He is tutored, madman'.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We let loose the torment for sometime, you will again do the same.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when We will seize the greatest seizing, verily We are to take vengeance.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We tested the people of Firawn before them, and an honourable Messenger came to them.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Saying, 'hand over to me the bondmen of Allah. Verily I am a trusted Messenger for you'.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Rise not up against Allah I bring to you a clear authority.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): I take refuge of my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if you believe not in me, go you apart from me.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he called upon his Lord, these are guilty people.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We commanded that go forth with My bondmen necessarily, you shall be followed.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And leave you the river open from place to place, undoubtedly the host shall be drowned.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): How many gardens and springs, they left behind.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And cornfields and nice houses.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And comforts wherein they were free from care.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We did thus, and We made another people to inherit them.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the heavens and the earth did not shed tears for them, nor were they given respite.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We delivered the children of Israel from the abasing torment.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): From Firawn, he was surely haughty and of the extravagant.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We chose them knowingly from among the people of that time

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We bestowed them the signs wherein there was clear reward.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): These men do say,

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'That is not but our first death and we shall not be raised?

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Bring back then, our fathers if you are truthful.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Are they better or the people of Tubba and those before them whom We destroyed? Verily they were culprits.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We made not the heavens and the earth and whatsoever is in between them in play.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We made not them but with truth, but most of them know not.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, the Day of Judgement is the term appointed for all of them.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when a friend shall not avail a friend at all and nor they shall be helped.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Save those on whom Allah has mercy. Undoubtedly He is the Honourable, the Merciful.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Verily the tree of Zaqqqum (Cactus)

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Is the food of the sinners.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Like molten copper bubbles in the bellies.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): As boiling water bubbles.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Seize him and drag him forcibly towards the center of the blazing fire.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'Then pour over his head the torment of boiling water.'

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Taste it, Yes, certainly you are the Honourable, the benignant.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, it is in which you were doubting

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, the God fearing is in a place of security.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In the gardens and springs.

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They shall wear fine silk and brocade facing one another.

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Thus it is, and We got them married to black and bright large eyed maidens.

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will ask for therein every kind of fruit in peace and security.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will not taste death therein, other than the first death, and Allah saved them from the torment of the fire.

57.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By the grace of your Lord. This is the supreme victory.

58.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We have made this Quran easy in your tongue so that they may understand.

59.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So, wait you. they too are waiting

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ha-Mim.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The sending down of the Book is from Allah, the Honourable, the Wise.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, there are signs in the heavens and the earth for the believers.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in your creation, and what He scatters of animals, there are signs for a people who are fully convinced.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in the alternation of night and day and in this that Allah has sent down rain the means of the Provision from the sky, whereby He gave life to the earth after its death and in the turning about of the winds, there are signs for the people of understanding.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): These are the signs of Allah that We rehearse to you with truth. In what word then after leaving the signs of Allah will they believe?

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Woe is to every imposter, sinner!

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who hears the signs of Allah being recited to him, then persists proudly, as if he has not heard them, so give him the glad tiding of a painful torment.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when he comes to know anything from My signs, he takes them in mockery. For them is an abasing torment

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Behind them is the Hell and nothing will avail them what they have earned, nor those whom they had taken as supporters beside Allah. And for them is the great torment.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is a guidance, and for those who disbelieved the signs of their Lord is the severest punishment of a painful torment.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is He who has subjected to you the river that the boats, may run on it by His command, and that you may seek His bounty and that you may be grateful.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And has made to work for you whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth by His Command. Verily in it are signs for a people who reflect.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Tell to the believers pardon those who hope not for the days of Allah so that Allah may recompense a people for their earnings

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whosoever does good, does it for his own soul, and whosoever does evil, does it for his own loss. Then to your Lord will you all be returned back.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly We bestowed the children of Israel, the Book, the Government and the Prophethood, and We provided them with pure things and exalted them over the people of their time.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We gave them bright arguments regarding this affair' so they differed not but after true knowledge had come to them through mutual jealousy. Undoubtedly, your Lord will decide between them on the Day of Judgement conceding that wherein they differ.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then We set you upon a nice path of that affair, there fore follow it and associate not with the desires of those who know not.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, they will avail you nothing against Allah. And verily, the unjust people are friends to one another. And the mend of God-fearing is Allah.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This opens the eyes of the people and is a guidance and mercy for a people believing.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do those who have committed evil deeds think that We shall make them like those who have believed and have done good works, so that their life and their death should be equal? What an evil judgement they give?

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah made the heavens and the earth with truth and that every soul may be recompensed for his earnings and they shall not be wronged.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): See you then, he who has made his desire to be his God and Allah led him astray despite his knowledge and set a seal upon his ears and his heart and laid a covering on his eyes. Who would guide him after Allah. Do you not then heed?

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they said, 'that is not hut this our wordily life. we die and we live and none destroys us but the time, and they have no knowledge of it they merely conjecture.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when Our bright signs are recited to them, then their only argument is that they say, 'bring our fathers, if you are truthful'.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'Allah gives life to you, then He will make you to die, then He shall gather you all on the Day of Resurrection of which there is no doubt, but most men know not

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And for Allah is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth and on the Day when the Hour shall be established, upon that day the people of falsehood will be the losers.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you shall see every people on their knees Every people will be summoned to their record. To day, you shall be recompensed for your doings.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Our this writing speak truth against you. We were recording whatever you did.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But those who have believed and have done good works, their Lord will take them in His Mercy, This is the open triumph.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who disbelieved, it will be said to them, 'were not My signs recited to you, but you used to wax proud and you were a people guilty.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when it is said, 'verily the promise of Allah is true and there is no doubt in the Hour,' you used to say, 'we know not what the Hour is, we have only a surmise and we are not convinced.'

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the evil of their deeds became apparent to them and they have been encompassed by the torment that they mocked at.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it will be said 'to them, 'Today We shall leave you as you had forgotten the meeting of this your day, and your destination is the fire and you have no helper.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That is for that you took the signs of Allah in mockery and the life of the world deceived you. Therefore today neither they will be taken out from the fire nor any one will wish that they may please Allah.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): All praise, then, to Allah, the Lord of the heavens, the Lord of the earth and the Lord of the worlds.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And for Him is the Greatness in the heavens and in the earth and He is the Honourable, Wise.

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ha-Mim.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This Book is the sending down from Allah, the Dignified, and the Wise.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We made not the heavens and the earth and what is in between but with truth and for a term appointed. And the infidels turn away from that they were warned of.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'well, tell you, what you worship besides Allah show me, what particle of the earth they have made, or they have any share in the heavens'? Bring me a Book before this or anything left over of knowledge, if you are truthful.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And who is more misguided than he who worship besides Allah such ones who may not hear his call till the Day of Resurrection and even they are unaware of their worship.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when mankind shall be gathered, they shall be enemies to them and will deny their worship.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when Our bright signs are recited to them, the infidels say concerning the truth having come to them, 'this is a magic manifest'

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do they say, 'he has fabricated it'? Say you, 'if I have fabricated it, you have no power for me against Allah. He knows well in what uttering you are busy. And He is Sufficient as witness between me and you, And He is Forgiving, Merciful.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'I am not a novel messenger and I know not, what shall be done with me and with you. I only follow what is revealed to me. And I am not but a plain warner.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'see to it, if that Quran is from Allah and you have disbelieved in it, while a witness from the children of Israel has already bore witness to it and he has believed, while you waxed proud'. Undoubtedly Allah guides not the unjust people.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the infidels said about, Muslims, 'if there had been some good in it, they could not have reached to it ahead of us. And since they have not been guided thereby, now, therefore, they will say, this is an old calumny.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And before it there is the Book of Musa, a guide, and mercy; and this is a book confirming in Arabic language that it may warn the unjust and good tidings to the righteous.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly those who said, 'our Lord is Allah, and then remained steadfast there shall be no fear upon them nor shall they grieve.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They are the people of Paradise, they shall abide therein a reward of their doings.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We commanded man to do good to his parents. His mother bore him with pain, and gave birth to him with pain. And his bearing and weaning are in thirty months, till when he reached to his strength and attained me age of forty years, he submitted, 'O my Lord, put in my heart that I may be thankful for Your blessing which You bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and that I may do such works which may please You, and make my offspring righteous for me. I turned towards you, and I am muslim.'

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): These are they whose good works We shall accept and will overlook their evil deeds. They are among the in habitants of Paradise -the true promise which was made to them.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And he who said to his parents, 'Fie, I am fed up with you both, do you promise me that I shall be brought forth again, whilst generations have already passed before me? And they both cry unto Allah for help, Woe to you; believe you, verily the promise of Allah is true. Then he says, 'this is not but the tales of the ancients'.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): These are they against whom the sentence has already been proved amongst the people of jinn and mankind at had gone before them. Undoubtedly, they were the losers.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And for everyone there is degree according to their own actions, and that Allah may pay them in full for their works, and they shall not be wronged.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the day the unbelievers shall be presented to the fire, it shall be said to them, You have already exhausted your pure things in your worldly life and have enjoyed them, therefore today you shall be recompensed with the degrading torment, a punishment for that you used to wax proud in the earth without right and a punishment for that you used to disobey.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And remember the compatriot of Aad, when he warned them in the land of Ahquaf (winding sand tracts) and undoubtedly, the warners have already passed away before him and have come after him (saying) worship none save Allah'. Undoubtedly I fear for you the torment of a great day.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'Have you come for this that you may turn us away from our gods'? Bring us then that with which you promise us, if you are truthful.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He said, 'the news thereof is only with Allah, and I only deliver to you the message of my Lord, yes, in my opinion you are totally ignorant people'.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then, when they saw the torment like clouds spread in the sides of the sky coming towards their Valleys, said, this is a cloud which will rain over us. Not so, rather it is that which you sought to hasten a windstorm wherein is a painful torment.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It destroys everything by the command of its Lord. So in the morning they remained as they were not seen but their deserted dwellings. Thus, We punish the culprits.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We had given them the control that we gave not to you; and made for them ears and eyes and hearts. But their ears and eyes and hearts availed them nothing, since they used to deny the signs of Allah and they were encompassed by the torment that they used to mock at.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We destroyed the cities round about you and brought varying signs so That they may desist.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Why, then did not those help them whom they had taken for God's beside Allah for attaining His nearness? Nay, rather they were lost from them, and thus is their calumny and fabrication.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when We turned to you a number of jinn, giving ear to the Quran and when they were present there said among themselves 'be silent', then when the recitation ended, they went back to their people warning.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'O our people.' We have heard a Book, that was sent down after Musa, confirming the former Books and guiding towards the truth and to the straight path.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O our people! Respond to the caller of Allah and believe in Him that He may forgive some of your sins and save you from the painful torment

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whoso responds not to the caller of Allah, he cannot go out of control in the earth and he has no helper against Allah. They are in manifest error.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have they not known that Allah, who made the heavens and the earth and was not wearied in making them, has the power to give life to the dead? Why not, undoubtedly He can do everything.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the day when the infidels shall be presented before the Fire it will be said to them, 'Is not this the truth'? They will say, 'why not, by our Lord'. It will be said to them, 'taste then the torment, the recompense of your infidelity'.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have you patience then, as had the resolute Messengers; and be in no haste about them, as on the day when they will see that they are promised with, (it will seem to them) they had not tarried in the world but for an hour of a single day. This is to deliver Then who shall be destroyed but the people dis-obedient.

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who disbelieved and hindered from the path of Allah, Allah has destroyed their deeds.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who believed and did good works and believed in what has been sent down upon Mohammad, and that is the truth from their Lord, Allah has removed from them their evils and has made good their conditions.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is because that the infidels followed the falsehood and the believers followed the truth which is from their lord. Thus, Allah narrates to people their descriptions.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore when you encounter the infidels, then there is smiting of the necks, till when you have fully slaughtered, then tie fast, and afterwards leave them, either by grace or for ransom, till the war lay down its burdens. This is so. And had Allah willed, He would have avenged Himself upon them, but that He may try among you one against the other. And those who have been killed in the way of Allah, Allah shall never render their works vain.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He will soon guide them and will set right their work.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And will make them enter the Paradise that He has made known to them.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! If you will help the religion of Allah, Allah will help you and will make your feet firm.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who disbelieved, for them is the destruction and Allah destroys their works.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is because they hated what Allah has sent down, so He has made their works futile.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have they, then not traveled in the land that they may see what became the end of those who were before them? Allah has cast destruction upon them and for the infidels there are so many the like thereof.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is because Allah is the Protector of the muslims and the infidels have no protector.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, Allah will make those who believed and did good works enter the Gardens underneath which the rivers flow; while the infidels enjoy and eat as cattle eat, and the Fire is their resort.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And how many a city that was stronger in might than this city which has driven you out have We destroyed, and they have no helper.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Will he then, who is upon a clear proof from his Lord be like him whose evil deeds have been shown fair to him and they followed their caprices'.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The description of the Paradise promised to the God fearing; therein are rivers of water which never stales; and rivers of milk of which the taste does not change, and rivers of wine of which the drinking is delightful; and the rivers of honey purified. And therein for them are every kind of fruit, and forgiveness from their Lord. Shall persons enjoying such comforts be equal to those who are to abide in the Fire and are given to drink boiling water so that it may cut their entrails into pieces?

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And among them are some who listen to you till when they go forth from before you say to the men of learning, 'what he has said just now?' These are they upon whose hearts Allah has set a seal and they followed their coprices.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who have been guided, Allah has added to their guidance and bestowed them their piety.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What they are then waiting for but the Hour that it should come upon them suddenly? The signs thereof have already come, therefore when it will come to them, then where will they be and where their understanding?

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Know you therefore that there is no worshipping save Allah and O beloved, ask forgiveness for the sins of your near ones and for general Muslim men and women. And Allah knows Your moving about in the day and your taking rest by night.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the muslims say, 'why not a sure has been sent down? But when any decisive Sura is sent down and therein fighting is ordained, you will see those in whose hearts is sickness looking at you with a look of one upon whom death has overshadowed but it was better for them.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That they would have obeyed and spoken good words. Then when the order has been finalized, if they were true to Allah, it would have been better for them.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you then have the sign that if you get the authority, spread disorder in the land and sever your ties of Kinship?

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): These are they whom Allah has cursed and made them deaf from the truth and made their eyes blind.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do they then ponder not over Quran, or there are locks on the hearts of some of them?

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who turned away to their backs after the guidance had become clear to them. The devil seduced them and gave them false hope of long living in the world.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That is because they said to those who hate what Allah has sent down, 'we shall obey you in one matter', and Allah knows their secrets.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): How then shall it be, when the angles will cause them to die, beating their faces and their backs?

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That is because they have followed what angers Allah and hated His pleasure, so He has rendered their works vain.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do those on whose hearts there is disease think that Allah will not bring to light their rancour?

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if We pleased, We could show them to you so that you should recognize them by their faces and you shall certainly recognize them by the tone of their speech. And Allah knows your deeds.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We shall certainly test you until We see those among you who struggle and are steadfast and try your tidings.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who committed infidelity and hindered from the way of Allah and opposed the Messenger after the guidance had become clear to them, they shall never harm Allah and He will make their works fruitless soon.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Obey Allah, and obey the Messenger and let not your works go vain.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of Allah and then died as disbelievers, Allah shall never forgive them.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So be not slack and call not yourself towards peace for you shall overcome and Allah is with you, He will never give you loss in your works.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The wordily life is but a sport and pastime. And if you believe and ward off evil, He will give you your rewards, and will not ask you your wealth.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If He asks them of you and asks more you would be niggardly, and the niggardliness will bring, to light the malice of your hearts.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Look here yes, you are those who are called upon to spend in the way of Allah, then of you there are some who are niggardly and whoso is niggardly is only niggardly to his soul. And Allah is self-sufficient. And you all are needy. And if you turn your face, He will substitute for you another people and then they will not be like you.

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have granted you a clear victory.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That Allah may forgive the sins of your farmers and of your lathers on account of you and may complete His favours upon you and may show you straight path

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that Allah may help you with mighty help.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He it is Who sent down satisfaction in the hearts of the believers so that they might add belief to their belief and to Allah belongs all the hosts of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Knowing, wise

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So that He may cause the believing men and the believing women to enter the gardens under neath which flow rivers, to abide therein and He may remove their evils from them. And this is the great triumph in the sight of Allah.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that He may torment the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women and the polytheist men and polytheist women who have evil thoughts concerning Allah. On them is the evil turn of fortune and Allah is worth with them, and has cursed them and has prepared Hell for them. And that is what an evil end

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And to Allah belongs all the hosts of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Dignified, Wise.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Surely, We have sent you as a witness (present and seeing) and a bearer of glad tiding and a warner.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So that O People you may believe in Allah and His Messenger and pay respect to him and honour him, and that you may glorify Him morning and evening.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who swear allegiance to you, swear allegiance to Allah. The hand of Allah is over their hands; so who-so ever breaks his oath, he breaks it to his own loss, and whosoever fulfils the covenant which he had made with Allah, then Allah shall soon give him a great Reward.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Now those desert Arabs who had remained behind will say to you, 'our possessions and our family members kept us busy, therefore now you ask forgiveness for us?' They say with their tongues that which is not in their hearts Say you, 'who has any power for you against Allah, if He desires you harm or if He desires you good.' Nay, Allah is Aware of your doings'.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nay! But you thought that the messengers and muslims would never return to their homes, and the same was understood by you fair in your hearts, and you conceived an evil thought, and you were a people to be ruined.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whoso believes not in Allah and His Messengers, We have surely prepared for the infidels a blazing fire.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And for Allah only is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whosoever He pleases and punishes whomsoever He pleases. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Now those who lagged behind will say, 'when you go to take the spoils, let us follow you. They desire to change the words of Allah'. Say you, 'you shall by no means follow us thus have Allah said before. Then now they will say, 'nay! But you are jealous of us. Not so rather, they understood not but a little.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say to the desert Arabs, who lagged behind, 'soon you shall be summoned to fight against a people of severe fighting that you shall fight them or they shall become muslims'. Then, if you will obey the command, Allah will give you a good reward, but if you will turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): No straitening there is on the blind and no harm on the lame, and nor there is penalization on the sick. And whoso obeys Allah and His Messenger, Allah will admit him into gardens underneath which streams flow, but whoso will turn away, he will torment him with a painful torment.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Surely, Allah was pleased with the believers when they were swearing allegiance to you under the tree, and Allah knew what were in their hearts, so He sent down on them tranquillity and rewarded them with a near victory.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And abundant spoils that they took. And Allah is Dignified, Wise.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah has promised you abundant spoils that you will take, and these He had hastened to you and has restrained the hands of the people from you and that it may be a sign to the believers and that He may guide you on a straight path.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And one more (victory) which was not under your power, that is in the possession of Allah. And Allah is Potent over every thing.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if the infidels should fight you, they would necessarily then turn their back from your confrontation; then they would not find any supporter nor helper.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is the practice of Allah that is being practiced from before, and you shall never find the practice of Allah changing.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it is He Who has restrained their hands from you and has restrained your hands from them in the valley of Mecca after He had given you control over them. And Allah sees your doings.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They are those who disbelieved and hindered you from the Sacred mosque, and the sacrificial animals were detained from reaching their place of sacrifice. And if it had not been for certain believing men and some believing women whom you knew not that you might have trampled them, and there befall you any harm from them unknowingly, We would have permitted you to fight. This protection of theirs is for that Allah may admit into His mercy whom He pleases. If they had been separated, necessarily then We would have punished the infidels among them with a painful punishment.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When the infidels harboured obduracy in their hearts the obduracy of the days of ignorance then Allah sent down His tranquillity on His Messenger and on the believers and made incumbent on them the words of righteousness and they were better entitled to it and more worthy of it. And Allah knows everything.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, Allah has proved true the true vision of His messenger. You shall no doubt, will enter the sacred mosque, if Allah pleases, in security, having their heads Shaven or having their hair cut short without any fear. But He knew what you knew not and appointed before that a near victory.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He Who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth that he may make it prevail over all other religions And Sufficient is Allah as witness.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Mohammad is the Messenger of Allah and those with him are hard against the infidels and tender among themselves you will see them bowing and prostrating themselves in prayer seeking grace of Allah and His pleasure. Their mark is on their faces from the traces of prostrations This description of their is in Taurah and their description is in Enjeel, as a cultivated field which puts forth its sprout, then strengthened it, then it became thick, then stood straight upon its stem, it looks pleasant to the cultivators that through them the hearts of the infidels may burn. Allah has promised unto those of them who are believers and do good, forgiveness and a great reward

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Exceed not over Allah and his Messenger and fear Allah. Undoubtedly Allah Hears, Knows

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Raise not your voices above the voice of the Communicator of unseen (the Prophet) and speak not aloud in presence of him as you shout to one another, lest your works become vain while you are unaware.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who lower down their voices in the presence of the messenger of Allah those are they whose hearts Allah has tested for piety. For them is forgiveness and great reward.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who call you from behind your private apartments, most of them are stupid.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if they had patience, until you yourself come out to them that had been better for them. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! If any disobedient comes to you with any news make a strict inquiry lest you may hurt any people improperly then remain repenting on what you have done.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And know that the Messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to do according to your liking in much of the affairs, you would then surely be in trouble, but Allah has endeared the faith to you and has adorned it in your hearts and He has made infidelity, and iniquity and disobedience hateful to you such persons are on the right course.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A grace and favour of Allah. And Allah is Knowing, Wise.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if two groups of the Muslims fight each other, then make peace between them, but if one of them commits excessiveness against the other, then fight the one that has committed excessiveness till it reverts to the command of Allah. Then if it reverts rectify between them with justice and do justice. Verily Allah loves the equitable.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Muslims are brothers, therefore make peace between the two brothers and fear Allah that the mercy may be shown to you.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Let not the men scoff at the men, perchance they may be better than those who scoff, and nor the women at other women, perchance that they may be better than those women who scoff, and do not taunt one another and nor call one another by nick-names. What a bad name is, to be called a disobedient after being a Muslim, and those who repent not, they are the unjust.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Avoid most suspicions, verily some suspicion is a sin and do not look out for faults and do not backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would abominate it. And fear Allah, Verily Allah is Oft Returning, Merciful.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O people! We created you from one man and one woman and made you branches and tribes that you may recognize one another. Undoubtedly, the most respected among you in the sight of Allah is he who is more pious, verily, Allah is knowing, Aware.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The villagers said 'we have believed'. Say, you, 'you believed not, yes, you rather say, we have surrendered', for the belief has not yet entered in your hearts. But if you shall obey Allah ends His Messenger, He will not make you to lose anything of your works. Surely, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The believers are only those who have believed in Allah and His Messenger and then, have never doubted and have struggled with their possession and their persons in the way of Allah. It is they who are truthful.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'do you tell Allah your religion? And Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. And Allah knows everything.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O beloved (prophet)! They take it as a favour to you that they have become Muslims. Say you, 'do not place the favour of your Islam on me; but rather Allah confers a favour upon you in that He has guided you to Islam, if you are truthful.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, Allah knows the unseen of the heaven and of the earth, and Allah is seeing your works.

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Qaf. By the glorious Quran.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But rather they wondered that there has come to them a warner from among themselves. And the infidels said, 'this is a strange thing.'

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Will when we be dead and become dust, we be raised again to life? This return is remote.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We know what the earth diminishes for them; and with Us is a Book preserving.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But rather they belied the truth when it came to them and so they are in a state of confusion.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have they not looked up to the sky above them, how We have built it and adorned it and that there is no rift therein

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the earth We have spread it out, and placed there in anchors of mountains and caused to grow therein every beautiful pair

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): An insight and understanding for every returning bondman.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We sent down out of heaven blessed water and We caused to grow thereby gardens and the grain that is harvested

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And tall palm trees with spathes piled one over another

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): As a provision for bondmen and We thereby revived a dead city. Thus is your coming out from the graves.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Belied before them the people of Nuh and the men of Rass and Thamud;

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the Aad, Firawan and the compatriots of Lut,

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the men of wood and the people of Tubba. Every one of them belied the Messengers and so the promise of My torment was proved.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have We then become weary by making for the first time? Nay, but rather they are in doubt regarding a new making.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And indeed We created man and We know what his soul whispers within him, and We are nearer to him than even his jugular vein.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When the two receivers receive from him, one sitting on the right side and another at the left.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Not a word he utters but there is sitting a watcher ready by him.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And there has come the stupor of death with truth. This is from which you were trying to run.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the Trumpet was blown. This is the Day of the torment promised.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And every soul came forth in this manner that with it there was a driver and a witness.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Assuredly, you were heedless of this, therefore We have removed from you the covering, so today your sight is sharp.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And his companion angel said, 'this is what is ready with me'.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It will be commanded cast you, twain into Hell every ungrateful, obstinate.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who is hinderer of the good transgressor, doubter.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who has set up any other God with Allah so you twain cast him into the severe torment.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): His associate devil said, 'Our Lord,' I did not make him contumacious, yes, he was himself in a tar off error'.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He will say, 'dispute not before Me' for I had already warned you of the torment'

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The word is not changed with Me, nor I wrong My bondmen.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when We shall say to Hell, 'are you filled up'? It will say, 'is some thing more'?

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The paradise shall be brought near to the pious that it shall be not far off from them.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is what is promised to you for every pertinent, watchful.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whoever feared the All Affectionate in the unseen and came to Him with a pertinent heart.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It will be said to them, 'Enter the Paradise in peace'. This is the day of Eternity.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For them there is whatever they desire and with Us there is yet more than that.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): How many a generation We destroyed before them that they were stronger in velour than they, then they searched about in the cities. Is there any place of refuge?

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, there is admonition in it for him who has a heart or who gives ear and be heedful.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Surely, We made the heavens and the land and what ever is in between in six days and weariness came not to Us.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore be patient over what they say, and sanctify your Lord praising Him before the rising of the sun and before its setting.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And sanctify Him in the late night and after prayers.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And listen attentively, the day when the caller will call from a place nearby.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when they will hear the uproar in truth. This is the day of coming forth from the graves.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We give life and cause death and to Us is the return.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when the earth will cleave as under from them and they will come out hastening. This is the gathering, quite easy for Us.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We are knowing well what they are saying and you are not a tyrant over them, therefore admonish by Quran him who fears My threat

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By those who scatter by scattering.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then the burden bearers.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then the smooth runners.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And then the distributors by command.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, what is promised to you is surely true.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, the justice is sure to be done.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By heaven that is adorned (by stars).

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): You are at variance in your talks.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He alone is turned away from this Quran who is destined to be turned away.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Killed be the fabricators.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who are forgetful in intoxication (of ignorance).

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They ask, 'when will be the day of judgements'.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It will be a day when they shall be tried on the fire.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it will be said to them, 'taste your trial'. This is what you were hastening.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Surely, the pious are in the gardens and springs.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Receiving what their Lord gives them. Surely, they were doers of good before that.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They used to sleep little by night.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in the last part of the night, they used to seek forgiveness.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in their wealth, there was the right of the beggars and the unfortunate.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It used to beat down the men as though they are the roots of uprooted palm trees

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in your own selves. Do you not then perceive?

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in heaven is your provision, and that you are promised.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, by the Lord of the heavens and the earth, verily this Quran is the truth in the same language, which you speak.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O beloved! (prophet) has the news of the honoured guests of Ibrahim come to you?

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When they came to him and said, 'peace', he said, 'peace', they are the persons strangers.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he went to his house and brought a fatted calf.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he placed before them. He said, 'do you not eat.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he began to fear in his heart on account of them, they said, 'fear not, and gave him glad tidings, of the birth of a son of knowledge.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then his wife came forward crying and smote her forehead and said, 'what! A barren old woman.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'thus has said your Lord. And He is the Wise the Knowing

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ibrahim said, 'and O angels! For what business you have come?

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'We have been sent to a sinful people.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That We may let, loose upon them stones of baked clay.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Which are with your Lord marked for the extravagant.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then We brought forth from the city those who were believers.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But We found there only one house of Muslims.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We left therein a sign for those who fear a painful torment.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in Musa also, when We sent him to Firawn with bright authority.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But he turned away with his army and said, 'a magician or a madman.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So seizing him and his army, We cast them into the sea in a condition that he was blaming himself

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in Aad too, when We sent to them a dry windstorm.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That it left the thing it came upon like a rotten thing.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in Thamud too, when it was said to them; enjoy yourselves for a while'.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But they rebelled against the command of their Lord then a thunderbolt overtook them before their eyes.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then neither they could stand up nor they could take revenge.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We destroyed the People of Nuh before them. Undoubtedly they were the people disobedient.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We have made the heaven with hands, and undoubtedly We are Makers of the vast extent.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We have made the earth a floor, and what an excellent spreader We are.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Abiding youths shall go round them carrying.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Goblets and ewers and cups with flowing drink before sight.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Where from they will have neither headache nor any unconsciousness.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And fruits that they like

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the flesh of birds as they desire.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And fair maidens with wide eyes.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Like preserved, hidden pearls.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The recompense for their doings.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They shall not hear therein any vain or any sinful talk.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Yes, this will be their saying peace, peace.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those on the right side, how are those on the right side?

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In the midst of thorn-less berry trees.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And clusters of bananas.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And abiding shade

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And ever flowing water.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And fruits abundants.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Neither ending, nor for bidden.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And raised couches.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We made those women grow with good growth.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And made them virgins.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Loving to their husbands, attracting them, of equal age.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For those on the right side.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A group from amongst the former ones.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And a group from amongst the later ones

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those on the left side,

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): How are those on the left side?

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In the midst of scorching winds and boiling waters.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the shadow of burning smokes.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Which is neither cool nor Honourable.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Verily before this, they were at ease.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And used to say, what! When we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we necessarily be raised up?

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And what! Our former fathers too?

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say. 'Surely, all former ones and later ones.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Shall necessarily be gathered to the appointed time of a known Day

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then, verily, O you the misguided ones, the beliers.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Shall surely eat of the tree of Zaqqum (Cactus).

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And fill your belies there will,

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And again you will drink thereon of boiling water.

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then you will drink as thirsty camel's drink.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is their entertainment on the Day of judgement.

57.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We have created you, why then, you do not accept the truth?

58.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So look you, the sperm drop that you emit.

59.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you make human being of it or We are the Maker?

60.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We have fixed death among you; and We are not to be outstripped by this

61.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That We may exchange the likes of you, and may fashion your faces in a manner, which you know not.

62.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, you have already known the first growth, why then, do you not reflect?

63.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Tell you then, what you sow?

64.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you make crop of it or We are the Grower?

65.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If We willed, We might trample it into pieces then you would remain lamenting.

66.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That we are indebted,

67.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Rather we remained deprived altogether.

68.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Tell you then, the water you drink.

69.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Did you send it down from the clouds, or We are the Sender?

70.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If We willed, We might make it bitter, what! Then, are you not grateful?

71.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Tell you then, the fire you kindle.

72.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Did you produce the tree thereof or We are the Producer?

73.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We made it a reminder of the Hell and a benefit for the wayfarers in the forest.

74.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore O beloved! Glorify the name of your Lord the Magnificent

75.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then I swear by the places where the stars set.

76.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if you know that is mighty oath.

77.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, this is an Honourable Quran.

78.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In a well preserved Book

79.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Touch it not but with ablution.

80.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is a sending down from the Lord of all Being.

81.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you then, show idleness in this statement?

82.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And do you keep for you this share that you belie?

83.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Why then it was not when the soul reaches to the throat.

84.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you are at that time looking on.

85.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We are near to it than you, but you have no sight.

86.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Why then it was not, if you are not to be requited,

87.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That you may send it back if you are truthful?

88.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then if the person dying is of the near ones,

89.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For him is the comfort and flower and a garden of delight.

90.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if he be of those on the right side,

91.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then O beloved, peace is upon you from those on the right side.

92.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if he be of the beliers, the misguided,

93.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then his entertainment is the boiling water.

94.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the thrusting into the blazing fire.

95.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, this is the truth of certainty.

96.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore O beloved', glorify the name of your Lord the Magnificent

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whatever is in the heavens and in the earth glorify Allah; and it is He the Esteemed one the Wise.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For Him is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth He gives life and causes to die, and He can do everything.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He is the First, He is the Last, He is the Manifest, He is the Hidden and He knows everything.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He Who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then seated Himself upon the Throne befitting to His Dignity. He knows what penetrates in the earth and what comes forth from it, and what comes down from heaven and what ascends into it. And He is with you wherever you may be. And Allah is seeing your works.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For Him is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And towards Allah is the return of all affairs.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He brings the night into the day and brings the day into the night. And He knows the toughts of the hearts.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Believe in Allah and His Messenger and spend in the way of Allah out of that to which He has made you heirs, And those of you who believed and spent in the way of Allah, for them is the great reward.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And what is to you that you believe not in Allah where as the Messenger is calling you to believe in Allah, and undoubtedly, He has already taken a covenant from you if indeed you believe.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He who sends down upon His bondman bright signs so that He may bring you forth from the darkness towards the light And verily. Allah is kind and Merciful to you

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And what is to you, that you spend not in the way of Allah, whereas to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth altogether. Those of you who spent and fought before the victory of Mecca are not equal They are greater in rank than those who spent and fought after victory. And to all has Allah already promised the reward of the paradise. And Allah is Aware of your deeds.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who is he who may lend to Allah a good loan and He may double it for him and there is an Honourable reward for him.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when you shall see the believing women that their light run before them and on their right. It is being said to them. 'To day the happiest tidings for you are those Gardens beneath which the streams flow wherein you will abide. This is the supreme triumph.'

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when the hypocrite men and the hypocrite women will say to muslims, 'look towards us. So that we may take something from your light,' It will be said to them'. 'Go you back and seek there a light. They will go back, henceforth a wall shall be set-up between them, in which there is a door. The inside of it has mercy and the outside has torment.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The hypocrites will call the muslims, saying, 'were we not with you?' They will say, 'why not, you put your souls in temptation and looked out for the evils of muslims and doubted and your vain desires deceived you till the decree of Allah came and the great Deceiver deceived you regarding the decree of Allah.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore this day no ransom shall be accepted from you or from the manifest infidels. Your destination is the Fire. It is your friend, and what an evil end it is!'

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Has not the time arrived for the believers that their hearts should lean for the remembrance of Allah and for the truth, which has come down. and that they should not become like those who were given the Book before, then the term was prolonged for them, so their 'hearts were hardened? And many of them are disobedients.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Know that Allah gives life to the earth after its death. Surely, We explained the signs to you that you may understand.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Surely, the alms giving men and alms giving women and those who gave a goodly loan to Allah, it shall be doubled for them and for them is an Honourable reward.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who believe in Allah and His Messengers, they are the perfect truthfuls and witnesses against others before their Lord. For them is their reward and their light, and those who disbelieved and belied Our signs, they are the inmates of Hell.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Know that the life of the world is not but a sport and amusement and an adornment and a source of boasting among yourselves and desiring multiplication in riches and children against one another It is like the rain whose vegetation pleased the tillers, then it dried up that you see it yellow then it was trampled into pieces. And in the Hereafter, there is severe torment and forgiveness from Allah and His pleasure. And the life of the world is nothing but a deceitful wealth.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Go forward towards the forgiveness of your Lord and towards a paradise of which the breadth is as the width of the heavens and the earth prepared for those who believed in Allah and His Messenger. This is the grace of Allah; He bestows it upon whom so ever He pleases. And Allah is the possessor of great grace

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): No calamity reaches either in the earth or in your own persons, but it is in a Book, before We create it; Undoubtedly, it is easy for Allah.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So that you may not give over what is lost to you, nor rejoice over what is given to you and Allah loves not any exultant, boastful.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Such as are niggardly and command men to be niggardly. And whosoever turns away, then surely, Allah is the self-sufficient, All Praised.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Verily We have sent Messengers with arguments and have sent down with them the Book and the Balance of justice, so that men might uphold justice And We have sent down iron, wherein is great strength and uses for mankind. And in order the' Allah may see him who help. Him and His Messengers with out seeing surely. Allah is Powerful Dominant

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We sent Nuh and Ibrahim and We placed Prophethood and the Book in their offspring so some of them were guided but most of them are disobedient.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then We sent after then. Our other Messengers following in their footsteps, and We sent following, Isa son of Maryam and bestowed him the Injil. And We placed tenderness and mercy in the hearts of his followers. And as for adopting monasticism they invented it into the religion on their own accord, We prescribed it not for them, yes this innovation they created for seeking the pleasure of Allah, but they observed it not as it was to be observed, so We gave the believers of them then reward, but most of them are disobedient.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believes! Fear Allah and believe in His Messenger He will give you a two-fold portion of His mercy and will provide for you a light wherein you will walk, and will grant you forgiveness. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is so in order that the non-believing people of the Book may know that they have no control over the grace of Allah and that the grace is entirely in the hands of Allah. He gives it to whomsoever He pleases And Allah is the Possessor of great grace.

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Surely, Allah heard the speech of her who pleads with you regarding her husband and makes her complaint to Allah and Allah is hearing the conversation of you two. Verily Allah Hears Beholds.
