2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those of you who leave their wives calling them as their mothers, they are not their mothers. Their mother is only those who gave them birth, and they certainly utter evil and purely false words. And undoubtedly, Allah is necessarily pardoning Forgiving.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who call their wives as in place of their mothers then wish to retract what they have Said, it is then incumbent upon them to free a slave before they touch each other, This is what you are admonished with, and Allah is Aware of your doings.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But whoso finds not a slave he should fast for two months continuously before they touch each other, and if any one is unable to fast, then he should feed sixty Poor people This is so that you may believe in Allah and His Messenger. These are the limits of Allah, and for the infidels is a painful torment.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who oppose Allah and his Messenger, were abased as those before them were abased; and We have undoubtedly sent down bright signs. And for the disbelievers is an humiliating punishment.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day Allah will raise them all together; He will inform them of their doings Allah has a ready kept an account of it, while they forgot it. And everything is before Allah

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O listener! Have you seen that Allah knows what ever is in the heavens and what ever is in the earth? Where there is secret counsel of three then the fourth is He. And of five then the sixth is He neither less than that nor more but He is with them wherever they may be. Then on the Day of Resurrection He will informs them of what they did Undoubtedly, Allah knows all things

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have you not seen them who were forbidden from evil counsels, then they do the same of what they were forbidden, And counsel among themselves of sin and transgressions and dis-obedience to the Messenger. And they come to you, they greet you with the words with which Allah has not greeted you and they say within themselves; why does Allah not punish us, for what we utter. Sufficient to them is Hell wherein they shall be thrust, what an evil end it is.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! When you counsel among yourselves, counsel not for sin and transgression and disobedience to the Messenger and counsel for virtue and piety, and fear Allah towards Whom you shall be gathered

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That secret counsel is only from satan (Devil) in order that he may grieve the believers and he cannot harm them at all without Allah's leave. And the muslims should rely upon Allah only.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! When it is said to you; make room in assemblies, then do make room; Allah will make room for you. And when it is said, 'rise up, then rise up; Allah will raise, in degree, those of you who believe and those who are endowed with knowledge. And Allah is Aware of your doings.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! When you desire to say anything secretly to the Messenger, then give some alms before your submission. This is better for you and purer. But if you are unable to give anything then Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Are you afraid of giving alms before your submission? But when you did not do so and Allah turned to you with His mercy, then keep up the prayer and pay poor due (Zakat) and remain obedient to Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Aware of your doings.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have you not seen those who took for friends a people upon whom is Allah's wrath? They are neither of you nor of them, they swear falsely knowingly.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah has already kept prepared severe torment for them. Undoubtedly, they do most evil works.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They have taken their oaths as shield, and they hindered from the way of Allah, for them, therefore, is the humiliating torment.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Their riches and their children will avail them nothing against Allah. They are men of Hell wherein they shall abide.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when Allah will raise them all together then they will swear before Him as they are swearing before you and they think that they have done something. Do you hear? undoubtedly, they are the liars.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Satan (the devil) has got control over them and has made them forget the remembrance of Allah. They are the party of Satan. Do you hear? undoubtedly, it is the party of Satan that are the losers.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, they are amongst the lowest.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah has already decreed that most surely I will prevail I and My Messenger. Undoubtedly Allah is Powerful, Dignified.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the last Day taking as their friends those who opposed Allah and His Messenger, even though they be their fathers or their sons or their brotheren or their kinsmen. These are they in whose hearts Allah has inscribed faith and helped them with a spirit from Himself, and will make them enter gardens beneath which flow streams, abiding therein, Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Allah. This is Allah's party. Do you hear'? it is Allah's party that is successful

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorifies Allah; and He is the Esteemed, the Wise.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He Who expelled the infidels of the Book from their homes for their first assemblage, you did not imagine that they would go forth and they thought that their fortresses would defend them against Allah. But the command of Allah came to them from whence they reckoned not, and it cast terror into their hearts that they destroy their dwellings with their own hands and the hands of the muslims. Therefore, take heed, O you, with eyes!

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And had it not been that Allah had decreed for them to be uprooted from their homes He would have punished them in this world. And for them is a torment of Fire in the Hereafter.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This because they resisted Allah and His Messenger and whoso resists Allah and His Messenger -then undoubtedly, the torment of Allah is severe

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whatever trees you cut down or left standing upon their roots, that was all by the leave of Allah and that He might disgrace the disobedients

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whatever spoils Allah gave to His Messenger from them, you rushed neither horse nor camel upon it, yes, but Allah gives control to His Messenger over whomsoever He please. And Allah can do everything.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whatsoever spoils Allah gave to His Messenger from the people of the cities is for Allah and His Messenger and for the near relation, and orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, so that it be not the wealth of your rich. And whatsoever the Messenger gives you, take it, and whatsoever he forbids you, abstain from that. And fear Allah; undoubtedly, the torment of Allah is severe.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For those poor refugees who were driven out from their homes and their possessions seeking grace of Allah and His pleasure, and helping Allah and His Messenger. They are the truthful

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who had established their home in this city and in faith from before, love those who emigrated to them, and find not in their breasts, any need for what they have been given and prefer them above their souls, even though they be badly in need of, and whoso is guarded against the avarice of his own soul, those they are the successful.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who came after them submit, O our Lord! Forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in the faith, and put not into our hearts any rancour towards those who believe. O our Lord! Undoubtedly, you are the Beneficent the Merciful.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have you not seen the hypocrites? They say to their brothers, the infidels of the Book, 'if you are turned out' we will surely go with you, and will never obey anyone against you, and if you are fought against, we will surely help you. And Allah witnesses that they are liars.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If they are turned out, they will not go forth with them, and if they are fought against, they will not help them. Even if they helped them. They would then run away turning their backs and then they shall not be helped.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, they have greater fear of you in their hearts than of Allah. This is because they are a people having no understanding.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They shall not even fight against you all together, but in fortified cities or from behind walls. Their velour is severe among themselves. You will think them as united gang, but their hearts are scattered. This is because they are a people having no sense.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They are like those who were just a short time before them. They tasted the evil consequences of their doings, and for them is the painful torment.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Like Satan (devil) when he said to man, 'disbelieve', and then when he disbelieved, he said, 'I am quit of you, I fear Allah the Lord of the entire world'.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the end of both was this, that they both are in fire, abiding therein. And such is the punishment of the unjust.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Fear Allah and let every soul should see that what it sent forth for the morrow' and fear Allah. Undoubtedly Allah is aware of your doings.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And be not like those who have already forgotten Allah, and so He put them in distress that they may not remember their own souls. It is they that are disobedients.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The inhabitants of the Fire and the inhabitants of the Paradise are not equal. The inhabitants of the Paradise they attained to their goal.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If We had sent down this Quran upon any mountain, you would certainly have seen it humbled and split asunder for fear of Allah. And those examples, We profound for mankind that they may reflect.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He is Allah, besides Whom there is none to be worshipped, the Knower of everything hidden and open. He is the Most Affectionate, the Merciful.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He is Allah, besides Whom none is to be worshipped the Sovereign, the most Holy, the Bestower of peace, the Giver of Security, the Protector, the Esteemed one, the Exalted the Majestic. Glory is to Allah from what they associate.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He is Allah, the Makers the Creater, the Bestower of form to everyone. His are all good names; all that is in the heavens and the earth glorifies Him: and He is the Esteemed One the Wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Take not for friends My and your enemies, you deliver the news to them in friendship, while they are deniers of the truth that has come to you, and drive out the Messenger and yourselves from homes because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you have come out in my path to struggle and to seek My pleasure, take them not for friends; you send them secret message of love, while I know well what you conceal and what you reveal. And whoever of you does so, has, undoubtedly, gone astray from the straight path.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If they get hold of you, they will be your enemies and will stretch forth their hands and their tongues towards you with evil, and they desire that you should anyhow become disbelievers.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Never will profit you, neither your kind-red nor your children on the Day of Judgement. He shall separate you from them. And Allah is seeing your doings.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, there was a good example to follow for you in Ibrahim and his companions, when they said to their people, 'undoubtedly' we are quit of you and that you worship beside Allah, we deny you', and there has appeared enmity and hatred between us and you for ever; until you believe in one Allah, but the saying of Ibrahim to his father 'I will surely ask forgiveness for you, and I have no authority for your any favour against Allah. O our Lord! In You do we put our trust and to You do we turn, and to You is the final return.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O our Lord! Put not us in a trial of those who disbelieve, and forgive us our Lord, undoubtedly You are the Esteemed one, Wise

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, there was a good example in them for you for him who has hope in Allah and the Last Day. And whosoever turns away, then undoubtedly Allah is self-sufficient, All-Praised.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is near that Allah may create friendship between you and those of them who are your enemies. And Allah is All Powerful, and Forgiving, Merciful.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah forbids you not regarding those who have not fought against you in religion and expelled you not from your homes, that you may show favour to them and act justly towards them. Undoubtedly, the just are loved by Allah.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah only forbids you regarding those who have fought against you in religion or expelled you from your homes or have helped others in driving you out, that you should take them for friends, and whosoever takes them for friends, they are the oppressors

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! When muslim women come to you from pagan territory leaving their homes, test them. Allah knows better as to their faith, then if you know them to be believing women, return them not to the infidels. Neither those women are lawful to them nor they are lawful to them. And give their unbeliever husbands what they have spent, and there is no blame on you if you marry them when you pay them their dowries. And have not firm hold to the matrimonial ties with the unbelieving women and ask back what you have spent and the infidels should ask for what they have spent. This is the order of Allah. He judges between you. And Allah is All Knowing, Wise.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if some women go away from the custody of muslims to the disbelievers, then you punish the disbelievers, and give from the spoils to those whose women have gone away the like of that which they had spent. And fear Allah in Whom you believe.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O Prophet! When muslim women come to you for taking oath of allegiance at your hands, that they will not associate anything with Allah, and they will not commit theft, and will not commit adultery and nor kill their children, and nor will bring a calumny forging it between their hands and feet (regarding birth) and will not disobey you in anything good, then accept their allegiance and beg Allah to forgive them. Undoubtedly Allah is Forgiving. Merciful.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Take not as friends those upon whom is Allah's wrath. They are indeed despaired of the Hereafter as the infidels are despaired of the inmate of the graves.

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah and He is the esteemed One, the Wise.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Why do you say, what you do not do?

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Most hateful is it to Allah that you say, what you do not do.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, Allah loves those who fight in His way arrayed in ranks, as though they were a building cemented with molten lead.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And remember when Musa said to his people, 'O my people why do you annoy me, though you know that I am the Messenger of Allah to you' But when swerved, Allah caused their hearts to swerve; and Allah guides not the disobedient people.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And remember when Issa son of Maryam, said, 'O children of Israel, I am Allah's Messenger to you, confirming the previous Book Tourat before me and conveying the glad news of the Messenger who will come after me, his name is Ahmad! ' But when Ahmed came to them with bright signs, they said, 'this is an open magic.'

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And who is more unjust than he who forges a lie against Allah despite the fact that he is being called towards Islam? And Allah guides not the unjust people.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They desire to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths and Allah is to accomplish His light, even though the infidels may take it bad.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He Who has sent His Messenger with the guidance and the Religion of Truth that he may cause it to prevail over all religions, though the associates may take it bad

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Shall I tell you the trade which may save you from painful torment?

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Believe you in Allah and His Messenger and struggle in the way of Allah with your wealth and persons. This is better for you, if you know.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He will forgive your sins and will make you enter the Gardens beneath which flow streams and palaces of purity that are in the gardens of dwelling. This is the great triumph.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And He will bestow you one more favour which you love, help from Allah and a near victory, so O beloved give glad tidings to the muslims.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Be helpers of the religion of Allah as Issa son of Maryam had said to his disciples, 'who are those who may help me being towards Allah? The disciples said, 'we are the helpers of the religion of Allah', then a party of the children of Israel believed and another party disbelieved. Then We helped the believers against their enemies, so they overcame.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah the Sovereign, the Most Holy, the Esteemed One, the Wise

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He Who sent among the unlettered people a Messenger from among themselves, who recites to them His signs and purifies them and bestows them the knowledge of the Book and wisdom, although they had been necessarily in manifest error before that.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And purifies and teaches others among them who have not met to those farmers. And He is the Esteemed One, the Wise.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is the grace of Allah; He bestows it to whomsoever He pleases. And Allah is the Owner of immense grace.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The example of those who were put up with Tourat, then they did not follow its mandate is like an ass carrying books on back. What an evil example is of those who belied the signs of Allah. And Allah Guides not the people unjust.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'O Jews! If you imagine; that you are the friends of Allah to the exclusion of others, then long for death, if you are truthful'

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But they will never long for it, because of the deeds which their hands have already sent forward. And Allah knows the unjust people

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'the death from which you flee, is certainly going to meet you, then will you be returned to Him Who knows everything hidden and open and He will inform you as to what you had done.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! When the call is made for the prayer on Friday, hasten towards the remembrance of Allah and leave business. This is better for you if you know

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then, when the prayer is finished, disperse in the land, seek grace of Allah, and remember Allah much; haply you may prosper.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when they saw any trade or sports they dispersed towards it and left you standing while addressing. Say, you that which is with Allah is better then sport and trade. And the provision of Allah is best

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When the hypocrites come to you, they say, 'we bear witnesses you are undoubtedly the Messenger of Allah, and Allah knows that you are His Messenger. But Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are most surely liars.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They have taken their oaths as shield and they kept back from Allah's way, undoubtedly, they are doing most vile works.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is so because, they believed with their tongues, then disbelieved with their hearts, therefore a seal has been set over their hearts, so now they understand nothing

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when you see them, their bodies seem pleasing to you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech attentively. They as though they were wooden beams fixed to a wall. They take every cry over themselves. They are enemies, therefore beware of them. Kill them Allah; whither are they perverting

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when it is said to them, 'come, that the Messenger of Allah may ask forgiveness for you, they turn their heads aside, and you see them that they turn aside their faces waxing proud

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Equal it is for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or not, Allah will never forgive them. Undoubtedly, Allah guides not the disobedients

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those are they who say, 'spend not on those who are with the Messenger of Allah until they disperse, where-as the treasures of the heavens and the earth are only for Allah, but the hypocrites understand not.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They say, 'if we return to Madina, the one most honour able will surely expel therefrom the one most mean, whereas the honour is for Allah, and His Messenger and Muslims, but the hypocrites know not

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Let not your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance of Allah and whoever does so, they are really in loss

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And spend something out of Our provision in Our way before death comes upon any of you and say, O my Lord! Why did You not grant me respite for a little time, so that I might have given alms and been among the righteous.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah will never grant respite to any soul when its appointed time has come; and Allah is Aware of your doings.

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Whatever is in the heavens, and whatever is in the earth glorifies Allah; His is the kingdom and His the praise, and He has power over every thing.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He who created you then some of you are disbelievers and some of you are muslims. And Allah is seeing your work.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He created the heavens and the earth with truth and He shaped you and made your shape good and to Him is the return.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and knows whatever you conceal and whatever you disclose. And Allah knows the thoughts within your breasts

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Has not the news come to you of those who disbelieved before? And they tasted the evil consequences of their action; And for them is the painful torment.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This because their Messengers brought to them manifest arguments but they said, 'shall a human being guide us' So they disbelieved and turned away and Allah cared not for then and Allah is Carefree, All Praised.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The infidels babbled that they shall never be raised up say you, 'why not, by my Lord, you shall necessarily be raised up, then you shall be informed of your doings.' And this is easy for Allah.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Believe, then in Allah and His Messenger and in the Light, which We have sent down, and Allah is Aware of your doings

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when He will gather you, on the Day of Gathering of all, that is the day for the manifestation of loss of the losers. And whoso believes in Allah, and does good deeds, Allah will remove his evils and will make them enter gardens beneath which streams flow, that they may abide therein forever. This is the great triumph

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who disbelieved and belied Our signs, they are the people of the Fire, they shall abide therein for ever. And what an evil destination it is.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): No calamity befalls but by the leave of Allah. And whosoever believes in Allah, Allah will guide his heart. And Allah knows everything.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn your face, then let it be known to you that Our Messenger is only responsible to deliver the Message clearly.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is, none is to be worshipped but He, then let the believers put their trust in Allah.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Some of your wives and children are your enemies, so beware of them. But if you pardon and over look and forgive, then, undoubtedly, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Your wealth and your children are only a trial; and with Allah is an immense reward.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, fear Allah as much as you can and listen the commands and obey and spend in the way of Allah for your own good. And whosoever is saved against the avarice of his own soul, they are the people to get prosperity.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If you will lend to Allah a good loan, He will double it for you and will forgive you. And Allah is Appreciating, Forbearing.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The Knower of every invisible and visible, All Esteemed, All Wise

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O Prophet! When you people divorce your women, then divorce them at the time of their prescribed periods and count the prescribed period, and fear Allah, your Lord. Turn them not out of their houses during prescribed period, nor should they themselves go out, unless they are involved in any flagrant indecency; These are the limits of Allah, and whoso crossed the limits of Allah, undoubtedly, he did injustice to his own soul. You know not that perhaps Allah may send any new commandment after it.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then, when they are about to reach their term, retain them with kindness or part from them with kindness and take two just persons as witnesses from among you and set up witness for Allah. By this, he who believes in Allah and Last Day is admonished. And he who fears Allah, Allah will make a way for his deliverance.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And will provide for him whence he expects not. And he who puts his trust in Allah -He is sufficient for him. Verily, Allah is to fulfil His work. Undoubtedly, Allah has kept a measure for every thing.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And as to your women who have no hope of menstruation; if you are in doubt, then their prescribed period is three months, and for those who have not yet menstruated. And the period of the pregnant women is when they give birth to children. And whose fears Allah, Allah will make his work easy.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is the Commandment of Allah that He has sent towards you. And whoso fears Allah, Allah will put off his evils and will give him immense reward.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Make the women to dwell where you yourselves dwell according to your means, and do not harm them so as to straiten them. And if they are pregnant, then give them their maintenance till they give birth to children, And if they suckle children for you, give them their wages and consult together reasonably. But if you mutually disagree then soon he (father) will get another woman for sucking.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Let the man of means provide according to his means. And as for him, upon whom his provision has been straitened, let him give the maintenance of what Allah has given him. Allah burdens no soul but to the extent of what He has given him it is near the Allah will bring about ease after hardship.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And how many a city rebelled against the Commandments of its Lord and His Messengers then We took a severe account from it, and gave it a horrible punishment

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore it tasted the mischief of its actions, and the end of its affair was loss.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah has already prepared for them a severe torment; therefore fear Allah, O men of understanding! Those who have believed. Undoubtedly, Allah has sent down for you an honour;

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The Messenger who recites unto you the bright signs of Allah, so that he may bring forth those who believe and do-good deeds from the darkness into light. And whoso believes in Allah and does good deeds -He will make him enter gardens beneath which streams flow, to abide therein forever. Undoubtedly, Allah has made good provision for him.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah is, it is He, who made seven heavens, and of the earth their like; the commandment comes down in their midst, so that you may know that Allah can do everything, and the knowledge of Allah encompasses everything

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O the communicator of the Unseen (Prophet) why do you forbid for yourself what Allah has made lawful to you, seeking the pleasure of your wives? And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, Allah has ordained for you absolution from your oaths; and Allah is your Protector, and Allah is Knowing, Wise

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when the Prophet told a secret matter to one of his wives, then when she disclosed it and Allah disclosed it to the Prophet, the Prophet made known to her some part, and overlooked some part thereof, And when the Prophet informed her of it she said 'who has informed you of it. He said, 'The Knowing, the Aware has informed me'.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): If you two wives of the Prophet turn towards Allah for your hearts are necessarily deviated from the path, but if you two force him, then undoubtedly, Allah is his helper, and Gibrael, and the righteous believers and after that the angels are his helpers.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is possible that, if he divorces you, his Lord may give him in exchange better wives than you; obedient, believing, well mannered, pertinent, devout in worship, fasting, married, and virgins

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers!, 'save yourselves and your family members from the Fire whose fuel is men and stones, over which are appointed angels, stern and severe, who disobey not the Commands of Allah and do what they are commanded.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O you the infidels! do not make excuses this day. You shall only be recompensed for what you used to do.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O believers! Turn towards Allah in such a way that it may become an admonition for future. It may be that your Lord will remove your evils from you, and make you enter the Garden beneath which flow streams, the day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believe with him. Their light will be running in front of them and on their right hands. They will say, 'O our Lord!!, complete our lights for us and forgive us'. Undoubtedly, You have authority over everything.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O the Communicator of unseen (Prophet)! strive hard against the infidels and hypocrites and be strict against them, And their destination is Hell. And what an evil end it is.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Allah sets forth the example of the infidels, the wife of Nuh and the wife of Lut. They were under marriage of Our two near ones bondmen, then they defrauded them. So they availed them nothing against Allah and it was said to them, enter you both into the Fire with those who enter.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah sets forth the example of muslims, the wife of Firawn. When she said, 'O my Lord! Build a house for me in the Paradise with You and deliver me from Firawn and his work and deliver me from the people unjust.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Maryam the daughter of Imran who preserved her chastity, so We breathed into her of Our spirit and she confirmed the words of her Lord and His Books and became of obedients

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Immensely blessed is He in Whose control is the entire Kingdom, and He has authority over every thing.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He, Who has created death and life that He might test you, as to whose work, is excellent among you. And He is the Esteemed one the Forgiving.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Who made seven heavens one upon the other. What difference do you see in the making of the Most Affectionate? Then look again carefully, do you see any crack

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then look again and again, the sight will return back to you defeated and fatigued.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, We adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and made them things to beat devils, and prepared for them the torment of blazing fire

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And for those who disbelieved in their Lord, there is the torment of Hell. And what an evil end it is?

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When they shall be thrown in it, they will hear the braying as it boils up.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It seems that it will almost burst with severe fury. Whenever any group shall be thrown in it, its keepers will ask them, 'Did no warner come to you'?

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will say, 'why not, yes indeed, the warner came to us, but we belied him and said, 'Allah has sent down nothing; you are not, but in great error".

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they will say, 'if we had heard or reflected, we would not have been among the fellows of the Hell.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Now they confessed their sins, then Curse be the fellows of the Hell.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, those who fear their Lord unseen, for them is forgiveness and great reward.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And whether you keep your discourse secret or disclose, He knows full well the thoughts of your breasts.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Will not He Who has created know? And it is He Knowing every subtle, the Aware.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is He Who has made the earth submissive to you, therefore traverse through its tracks and eats of His provision. And to Him is the rising up.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have you become fearless of Him whose Kingdom is in the heaven, that He may bury you in the earth, henceforth it remains shaking?

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or have you become fearless of Him whoso Kingdom is in the heaven that He may send against you stoning. Now you will know, how was My warning?

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, those before them belied, then how was My rejection.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And have they not seen birds above them, spreading out their wings and closing them? None withholds them save the Most Affectionate Allah. Undoubtedly, He sees all things.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or which is your army that shall help you against the Most Affectionate Allah? The infidels are not but in delusion.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or who is he, who may provide you, if He withholds His provision? Nay, but they have become shameless in contumacy and dis-dain.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Is he who walks prone on his face better guided than he who walks upright on a straight path?

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'it is He Who produced you, and made for you ears and eyes and hearts'. How little you accept the truth?

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'it is He Who has spread you in the earth, and towards Him you shall be raised.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they say, 'when this promise will come to pass. if you are truthful'.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'the Knowledge of it is with Allah, and I am only a clear warner'.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when they will see it near at hand, the faces of the infidels will be vexed, and it will be said to them, 'this is what you used to ask for'.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'look to it, if Allah destroys me and those with me or has mercy on us, then who will protect the infidels from the painful torment'?

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'He is the Most Affectionate, we believed in Him and relied upon Him, then now you will know, who is in manifest error'.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'look to it, if your water in the morning go deep in the earth, then who would bring you water running before your eyes?

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By the pen and by that which they (angels) write.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): You are not. by the grace of your Lord, mad.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And certainly, for you there is an endless reward.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, you possess excellent manners.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then now you shall soon see and they shall also see;

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): As to which of you was caught with madness.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, your Lord knows well him who goes astray from His path, and He knows well those who are guided

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, hear not the words of the beliers.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They desire that any how you should be appeased then they too would be appeased.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And hear not any such one who is a big swearer the mean.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): One who taunts a lot, going around with slander.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Forbidder of good, transgressor, sinful.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ill-mannered, and moreover his birth is faulty.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): This is because he possesses some wealth and children.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When Our signs are recited to him, he says 'stories of the ancients'.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We shall soon brand upon his swine like snout.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they swore that they would certainly reap their crop in the morning.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they said not 'if Allah please'.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then something going round from your Lord went round it while they were asleep.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in the morning it was as it were fruits plucked.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then they called one another in the morning.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Saying, 'go to your fields early in the morning if you are going to reap'.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they went forth early in the morning, whispering together.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That no needy person should come in your garden today.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they went forth early in the morning, determined upon their purpose.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But when they saw it, they said, 'undoubtedly, we have lost our way'.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nay, rather we have been deprived of every thing.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, why do you not glorify Allah? "

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'Glory is to our Lord, undoubtedly, we had been unjust.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Now one turned towards other reproaching.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, 'Ah! Woe to us, undoubtedly, we were contumacious.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better than it, we do humbly turn to our Lord.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Such is the punishment, and the punishment of the Hereafter is far greater. What a good thing it was, if they knew?

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, for the God fearing, there are Gardens of Bliss with their Lord.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Shall We make the muslims like the culprits?

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What happened to you? How you judge?

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Have you any Book wherein you read?

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That you shall have in it whatever you choose?

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or have you some oaths from Us, reaching to the Day of Resurrection that you shall have all that you claim?

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Ask them which of them is guarantor thereof?

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or have they some associates? Let them, then bring their associates, if they are truthful.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when a leg shall be exposed (the meaning is known to Allah) and they will be called upon to prostrate themselves, they will not be able to do so.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Their eyes will be cast down, and humiliation will be covering them, and they were indeed called upon to prostrate themselves in the world when they were sound healthy.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So leave him to Me, who belies this word. Soon We shall draw them step by step whence they know not.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And I shall grant them respite, undoubtedly, My secret planning is very strong.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or do you ask them a wage so that they are laden with debt?

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or is the unseen with them so that they are writing?

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore wait for the command of your Lord and be not as the Man of the Fish when he called out while his heart was choking.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Had not the favour of his Lord reached him for his care, he would have surely been cast upon land blamed.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then his Lord chose him and made him of His near ones.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it seems that the infidels with their bad looks will necessarily, stumble you when they hear Quran and they say, 'He is surely faraway from wisdom'.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it is not, but an admonition for the worlds

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That inevitable truth.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): How is that inevitable truth?

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And what did you know how is that inevitable?

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Thamud and Aad belied that strong calamity.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then as for Thamud they were destroyed with an extreme uproar.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And as for Aad, they were destroyed by a fierce roaring windstorm.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Which He subjected them forcefully for seven nights and eight days consecutively, then see those people in it lying down, as though they were trunks of palm-trees lying down.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you see any remnant of them?

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Firawn and those before him, and the overthrown towns committed error.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord; therefore, He seized them with a strong seizing.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, when the water rose high, We bore you in the boat.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That We might make it a reminder for you and it might be retained by the ears that retain after hearing.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then when the trumpet is blown instantly.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the earth and the mountains are being crushed after lifting up all at once.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That is the day when will happen the inevitable event.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the heaven will cleave as-under, then on the day it will be in a miserable condition.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the angels will be standing on the sides thereof, and on that day, the eight angles will bear over them the throne of your Lord.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): On that day, you all shall be presented and no hiding soul shall remain hidden.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then as to him, whose record shall be given in his right hand, he will say, 'take and read my record'.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): I was convinced that I would reach to my accounting.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, he is in his desired comfort.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In a lofty Garden.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Its clusters are within reach.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Eat and drink a content full recompense for that you sent forth in the days gone by.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And as for him whose record shall be given in his left hand, he will say, 'oh would that, I had not been given my record!

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And I would not have known what is my reckoning.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Oh, would that death had made an end of me.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): My wealth has availed me nothing.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): My all strength has gone from me.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Seize him and put chains in his neck.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then cast him into blowing fire.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then thrust him in a chain the length of which is seventy cubits.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, he did not believe in Allah the Great.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And he did not urge the feeding of the needy.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore, he today has no friend here.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nor any food saves pus of the people of Hell.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Which none but the sinners eat.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But no, I swear by what you see.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And by all that, you see not.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, this Quran is the talks with a noble Messenger.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it is not the word of any poet. How little you believe!

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it is not the word of any sooth sayer. How little you heed!

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): I have been sent down by Him who is the Lord of entire world.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if he would have said against Us even one word forging from himself.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We would surely have taken revenge with full force.

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And then We would surely have severed his life vein.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And not any of you could have defended him.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly; this Quran is an admonition to the God-fearing.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And surely, We know that some among you are beliers.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, it is a great sorrow to the infidels.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, it is the truth of absolute certainty.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So O beloved prophet! glorify your Lord the Great

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A questioner asks for the torment to befall.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Upon the infidels, which there is none to repel.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It will be from Allah the Master of Ascending heights.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The angels and Jibrael ascend towards Him. That chastisement will fall on a day the measure of which is fifty thousand years.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So be you patient with a goodly patience.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They are thinking it to be far off.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We are seeing it to be near.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when the heaven will become like molten silver.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the mountains will become so light as wool.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And no friend will ask any friend.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will be seeing them. The culprit will long that he might ransom himself from the torment of that day by his sons,

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And his wife and his brother,

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And his clan in which there is place for him.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And all those who are on the earth, then this ransom might save him.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Never, it is indeed a raging fire.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Putting off the skin.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It is calling him who turned his back and turned his face.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And hoarded wealth and withheld it.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, man has been made impatient greedy.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): When evil touches him, he is badly perplexed,

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when good reaches him, he withheld,

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But those who pray,

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Those who are constant in their prayer.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those in whose wealth there are a known right.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For one who asks for and for one who could not even ask for and remains deprived.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who know the Day of judgement a reality.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who are afraid of the torment of their Lord.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, the torment of their Lord is not a thing to become un-fearful.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who guard their private parts.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But from their wives and from those whom their hands possess. They are not to be blamed for them.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And who seeks others save those two then they are the transgressors.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who safeguard their trusts and their covenant,

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who are firm on their testimonies,

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And those who preserve their prayers.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They are, who shall be honoured in the Gardens.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But what happened to those infidels, that they see towards you with sharp eyes.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): On the right and the left, groups after groups.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Does every man among those covet that he shall enter the Garden of comfort?

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Never, undoubtedly, We have made them of that which they know.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): I swear by the Lord of the easts and wests that We are surely, Authoritative.

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That We may exchange better than they are, and no one can go out of Our hands.

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So leave them in their idle talks and play until they meet that day of theirs, which they are promised with.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The day when they will come forth from their graves hurrying as if they were hastening towards marks,

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): With their eyes cast down, covered with disgrace. This is their that day of which they were promised

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We sent Nuh towards his people saying warn them before a painful torment comes to them.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He said, O my people, I am to you a manifest warner.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That worship Allah, and fear Him, and obey Me.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He will forgive some of your sins and grant you respite till an appointed time. Undoubtedly, the promise of Allah cannot be deferred when it comes. Any how you would have known.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He submitted, O my Lord, I have called my people night and day.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But my calling has only increased them in fleeing away.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And every time I called them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers into their ears, covered themselves with their garments, and persisted and waxed great proud

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then I called them openly.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then I spoke to them publicly and spoke to them in secret too.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And I said, 'beg forgiveness of your Lord, He is Most Forgiving.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He will send down upon you rain in torrents.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And He will help you with wealth and children and will make for you gardens and will make for you streams.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What happened to you? that you hope not to achieve honour from Allah.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): While He has made you in diverse stages.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Do you not see that Allah has made seven heavens one upon another?

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And He illuminated therein the moon and has made the sun as a lamp.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah has caused you to grow from the earth like vegetation.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then He will cause you to return there to and will bring you forth for the next time.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Allah has made the earth for you as a bed spreading.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That you may walk through its wide ways.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nuh said, 'O my Lord! they disobeyed me and followed such one whose wealth and children have only added to his losses.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they have plotted a tremendous plot.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they said, 'never leave your gods and leave not Wadd nor Suwa nor Yaghuth and Yauq and Nasr'. (idols of pagan Arabs)

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And undoubtedly, they have led many astray; so increase You not the unjust but in error.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And because of their wrong doings, they were drowned, then made to enter the Fire. Then they found not for themselves any helpers against Allah.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And Nuh submitted, 'O my Lord leave not of the infidels any inhabitant upon the earth'.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, if You would allow them to live, they will lead astray Your bondmen and they will beget none but an evil doer, an ungrateful.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O my Lord! forgive me and my parents and him who is in my house as a believer and all believing men and all believing women'

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'it has been revealed to me that some of Jinn listened my recitation attentively and said 'we have heard a wonderful Quran'

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That guides towards righteousness, so we have believed in it, and we shall never associate anyone with our Lord

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that the majesty of our Lord is exalted high. He has neither taken a woman nor a child.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that the fool among us used to utter extravagant words against Allah.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that we thought that neither men nor Jinn would ever fabricate a lie against Allah.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that some individuals from among the men used to seek protection of some men from among the Jinn and they thus increased them in their pride.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that they imagined just as you have imagined, that Allah would never raise any Messenger.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that we touched the heaven then we found it filled with strong guards and sparks of fire.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that we used to sit on some seats to listen in the first heaven, but whoso now listens finds a flame of fire in wait for him.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that we know not whether any evil has been intended for those living on earth or their Lord has desired any good for them.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that there are some amongst us righteous and some of us are otherwise. We are divided into different ways.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that we are convinced that in no case we can ever go out of the control of Allah in the earth nor we can go out of His control by flying.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. And whoso believes in his Lord, has no fear of any loss or high-handedness.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that there are some Muslims and some unjust persons amongst us. So those who embraced Islam, it is they who sought the right course.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And as to the unjust, they became the fuels of Hell.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And say you, 'I have been revealed that if they would have been on the right path, we would have certainly provided them with abundant water.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In order that we may test them therewith, and whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will make him join a rising torment.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that the mosques are only for Allah, so worship none with Allah.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And that when the bondman of Allah stood up praying Him, it was nigh that those jinn may crowd upon him.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'I pray to my Lord only, and I associate none with Him'.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, I am not owner of either bad or good for you'.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, None will save me from Allah, nor I shall find any place of refuge besides Him'.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): (To me is), but to convey the orders of Allah and His Messages and whoso dis-obeys Allah and His Messenger, then surely for him there is the fire of Hell, wherein they shall abide for ever.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Until when they will see that which they are promised then they will now know, who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Say you, 'whether that which you are promised is nigh, or my Lord will give it some time.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The Knower of Unseen reveals not His secret to anyone.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Except to His chosen Messengers, and appoints guard before them and behind them.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So that He may see that they have delivered the Messages of their Lord. And that He knows all that is with them, and He has already counted everything in numbers

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O the enwrapped one!

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Stand praying at night except a small portion thereof.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Half night or make it a little less than that.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Or make it a little more than that and recite Quran slowly and thoughtfully.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, soon We shall be casting on you a weighty word.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, getting up at night is most pressing and the word is pronounced most rightly.

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, you have a chain of engagements during the day.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therefore remember the name of your Lord, and be of Him exclusively leaving all others.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He is the Lord of the east and west, there is no god but He, so take Him as Disposer of Affairs.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And be patient over what the infidels say and leave them decently.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And leave to Me those beliers the rich ones and give them a little time.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have heavy fetters and raging fire.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And a choking food and a painful torment.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): On a day when the earth and the mountains shall quake, and the mountains will become heaps of sand flowing.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We sent towards you a Messenger who is a witness over you, as We sent to Firawn a Messenger.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But Firawn dis-obeyed the Messenger, then We seized him with a severe seizing.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then how you will save yourselves if you disbelieve against a day which will make children old.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The sky will be split on account of its grief. The promise of Allah shall be fulfilled.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, this is an admonition, therefore, let him who please take a way unto his Lord.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, your Lord knows that you stand up for prayer sometime for nearby two third of the night, sometime half of the night, sometime a third of the night, and also a party of those who are with you. And Allah estimates the night and the day. He knows that you muslims can not count the night, then He turned towards you with His mercy, now recite from Quran as much as is easy for you He knows that soon some of you will fell ill and some others will travel in the earth seeking the bounty of Allah and some others will be fighting in the way of Allah, so recite Quran what you can, and continue keeping prayer and pay, the poor-due (Zakat) and give a goodly loan to Allah. And whatever good you will send forward for you, you will find it with Allah as better and greater reward. And beg forgiveness from Allah. Undoubtedly, Allah is Forgiving Merciful

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'O the mantled (a coverlet) one;

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Stand up, then warn;

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And magnify your Lord alone;

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And keep clean your clothes;

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And remain away from the idols;

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And bestow not favours to anyone seeking increase;

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And be patient for the sake of your Lord.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For when the trumpet shall be blown;

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That day is then a harsh day;

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For the infidels it is not easy.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Leave him when I created alone to Me;

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And bestowed him ample wealth.;

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And sons present before him;

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And I prepared for him numerous preparations;

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he covets that I may give him more;

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Never, he is hostile to Our signs.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Soon, I shall cause him to ascend to the mountain of fire sand.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Certainly, he reflected and determined;

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then be he cursed how he determined;

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Again, be he cursed, how he determined;

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he looked about;

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he frowned and scowled;

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he turned his back and waxed pround.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And said, 'this is the same magic learnt from old ones'.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): 'This is not but the word of man'.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): I shall soon thrust him into the Hell.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And what did you know what the hell is?

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It leaves not and spares none.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It takes out the skin of man.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Over it, there are nineteen guards.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And We have not made the guards of the hell but the angels, and We have not kept their calculation but as a test of the infidels, in order that those who are men of the Book may be convinced and the faith of the believers may increase, and those who are men of the Book and the muslims may not doubt, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the infidels may say, "what does, Allah mean by such a strange illustration? In this way Allah leads astray whom He will and He guides whom He will. And none knows the hosts of your Lord save He. And this is nothing but an admonition for man.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Yes, by the moon.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the night when it retreats.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And by the morning when it shines.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, the hell is one of the greatest things

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): A warning to man.

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For any one of you, who wishes to advance or to fall back.

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Every soul is pledged for what it has done.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But those on the right hand.

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): In Gardens, they ask;

41.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): From the culprits;

42.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What brought you into the Hell.

43.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They said, We used not to offer prayer.

44.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And we used not to feed the needy ones.

45.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And we used to indulge in objectionable talk with those who indulge therein;

46.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And we used to belie the Day of judgement.

47.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Until death over took us.

48.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So the intercession of the intercessors will be of no use to them.

49.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Now what happened to them that they turn their faces from admonition.

50.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): As if they are frightened asses.

51.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Fleeing from a lion.

52.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nay, rather every one of them wishes that he may be given open sheets of revelation;

53.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Never, but rather they fear not the Hereafter.

54.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Yes, no doubt this is an admonition.

55.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So that, whoever wishes may take admonition thereof.

56.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they will not accept admonition unless Allah so Please. He alone is worthy to be feared and He alone is worthy to forgive

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): I call to swear by the Day of Resurrection.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And I do swear by the self-blaming soul.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Does man think that We shall not assemble his bones?

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Why not, We are powerful to restore his very fingertips.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But man desires to do wrong infront of him.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He asks, when will be the Day of Resurrection?

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But when the eyes is dazzled.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the moon is eclipsed.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And the sun and the moon will be joined together.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): On that day the man will say, where is place to run away to?

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Never, there is no refuge.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): On that day, one is to take towards your Lord alone.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): That day man shall be informed as to what he has sent forward and what he left behind.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): But rather man has complete sight over his own condition.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And if he brings all excuses he has, even then he will not be heard.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Move not your tongue with Quran that you may hasten to learn it.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, it is upon Us to preserve it and to recite.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So, when We have already recited it follow then its recital.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then it is upon Us, to make clear its minute details.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Nothing, rather you O infidels! love near life.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And you have already neglected the Hereafter.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Some faces on that day will be fresh.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Looking towards their Lord.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And some faces that day will be sad and dismal.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Thinking that back-breaking calamity will befall them.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Yes, when it will reach to the throat.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And it will be said, Is there any one who may exorcise?

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And he (the dying man) will think that it is the hour of parting.

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And shank will intertwined with shank.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): The drive that day is towards your Lord.

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): For neither he accepted the truth nor offered prayers.

32.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Yes, he belied and turned his face.

33.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he departed to his home arrogantly.

34.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Woe is near to you, now woe is near.

35.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Again, woe is near to you, now woe is near.

36.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Does man think that he will be left free?

37.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Was he not a sperm of emission emitted?

38.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then he became a clot, and then He created him and perfected him.

39.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And then He made of him a pair. The male and female

40.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Would the One who has done all these things be not able to give life to the dead

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, there has come upon man a time when there was no mentioning of his name anywhere.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We created man from a mingled sperm drop that We might try him, so We made him hearing, seeing.

3.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have shown him the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.

4.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, We have already prepared for the infidels' chains and iron collars and a blazing fire.

5.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, the virtuous will drink of a cup whereof the admixture is camphor.

6.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What is the camphor, it is spring wherefrom the most special bondmen of Allah will drink. They will make it gush forth wherever they would like in their places

7.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They fulfil their vows, and fear a day the evil of which is wide-spread.

8.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And they feed, for love of Him, the poor. The orphan and the prisoner.

9.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They say to them, 'We feed you for Allah pleasure only. We desire no recompense or thanks from you'.

10.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, we fear from our Lord a day, which is frowning and very hard.

11.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So Allah has saved them from the evil of that day and granted them cheerfulness and happiness.

12.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And recompensed them for their patience with a Garden, and silken clothes.

13.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): They will be reclined upon coaches in the Garden neither they will see therein sunny heat nor excessive cold.

14.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And its shades will be inclined over them, and its clusters would have been made hanging down.

15.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And there shall be passed around them silver vessels and goblets, which will be bright as glass.

16.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What type of glass, glass of silver, the cupbearers would have placed them on complete measurement.

17.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Therein, they shall be made to drink a cup whose mixture will be ginger.

18.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): What ginger is, it is a spring in the Paradise called Sal-Sabil.

19.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And never aging youths shall go around them for service, when you see them; you think them to be pearls sprinkled.

20.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And when you look to them, you see a bliss and a great Kingdom.

21.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Upon their bodies, there are green silken garments and brocade and are made to wear bracelets of silver. And their Lord made them to drink pure beverage.

22.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): It will be told to them, this is your recompense, and your labour bore fruits.

23.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly We have sent down the Quran on you in piece-meal.

24.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): So be you patient under the order of your Lord, and hear not anyone of them sinner or unthankful.

25.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And remember the name of your Lord morning and evening.

26.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And in part of night, prostrate yourself before Him and magnify Him through the long night.

27.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly these people love the things under feet, and has already left behind a heavy day.

28.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): We created them, and strengthened their joints, and when We will, We shall exchange their likes

29.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Undoubtedly, this is an admonition, so whoever wishes may take a way unto his Lord.

30.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): And what you will, but only this Allah wills. Undoubtedly, He is All-Knowing, Wise

31.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): He causes whom He pleases to enter His mercy, and for the unjust, He has already kept prepared a painful torment

1.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): By those sent forth continuously.

2.Ahmed Raza Khan (Barelvi): Then pushing on with force.
